Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: SRQgirl617
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! The location was just a quick cab ride to old San Juan, but far enough away to be nice and quiet! The pool area is amazing! Beautiful views of old San Juan and the cruise ships. The rooms were clean and comfy. We didn't spend any time in the casino, but it looked large and quite popular. There's a Texas de Brazil restaurant attached to the hotel, which as usual was amazing and so convenient. We ordered a drink from the small bar directly across from the front desk.. Can't remember the name, but it was made with real watermelon... Sooooo yummy! Must try! Lastly, I just want to mention that I booked this hotel through an auction website, and although I noted that there were 3 people in our party, I always like to check to make sure they reserved us a room with 2 beds. I emailed the manager of the hotel and received a very quick and friendly response. I appreciated that! Overall this is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad location.”
Reviews.Author: Snamias
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. The location was horrible. It literally in the middle of nowhere. Although its very close to the city, its still a disappointment. You have to rent a car to stay here. Everything else was perfect. Good staff, yummy food, & very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - very close to the cruiseship pier”
Reviews.Author: Belfast1951
Reviews.Content: On Saturday April 7, 2012 I arrived at the hotel, a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews. I am totally impressed with the hotel and staff. Originally I was quoted $239 for one night accommodation - but I was on their website and noticed that if you had a AAA membership or CAA that there was a special price of $149. So I promptly booked the on-line special and cancelled the original booking. Someone mentioned that there was a mexican restaurant across the street from the hotel - I did visit the restaurant (very small) and although I ate there I was not impressed as it was "fast food" type meals. After eating at the mexican restaurant I then checked the menu at the Sheraton and would have been happier eating there (the pricing was not much different). The concierge at the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful (wish I could remember his name) He helped me get a taxi for mass on Easter Sunday morning and when I mentioned that I needed to take my luggage with me (I was boarding the Princess cruise ship) he told me that it could be stored at the hotel and that the cruise pier was literally 5 minutes walk. I was quite happy to return to the hotel, collect my luggage and walk to the pier. Thank you Sheraton Hotel - I had a very comfortable stay and many thanks to the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, good street parking”
Reviews.Author: ziggyziggy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in the first week of April. The check-in process was quick as there was a special line for gold and platinum members. We were given a room on the top floor (12) for being a gold member but was denied access to the club lounge. This is the first Sheraton that denied me but they told me there were new rules and only platinum members are entitled. Oh well. We rented a car so location is not an issue for us. it was dirt cheap for $20 a day. Driving to the beaches like Condado is literally 5 minutes away. I strongly suggest not to pay $16 a day for parking in the lot since street parking was not that tough. We managed to park near the hotel everytime we came back. Just make sure not to park on streets with yellow lines or the one block designated to valets and you should be fine. There are two blocks between the hotel and the outdoor lot that is free and there is one block in front of the valets and another two blocks by the construction site leading to the highway. You will see it when you get there, If all else fails, the construction site area is a good bet for a spot. Driving southbound will take you to a mall, Plazas Las Americas. Its like any other mall in the USA. Also catch a movie there, a ticket only cost $7.50, what a steal! As for the hotel, it is quite new, opened 2 years ago and everything is in good condition. The pool area is nice except we found locals using it on weekends. I guess nobody really checks ids or keys. It was a little roudy but otherwise the pool is very nice, on the 4th floor with a view. The casino is nice and small but has all the slot machines you need and there is even live music on certain days. Make sure to eat at the Churrascaria (Brazilian BBQ). It is $50 per person but it is all you can eat meat and salad so its not too bad. The service is top notch and the food is tastey, albeit a little salty to some. Overall, I recommend this hotel to anyone. The lobby is lively on all days at all times and everything feels clean and neat. We dont know how public transport is or how good housekeeping is because we opted for the 500 points bonus for not using housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with resort amenities close to cruise ship”
Reviews.Author: Ringettechick
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Puerto Rico Review This review is from a Platinum Starwood member point of view. We stayed one night before our cruise and one night after our cruise. Some passengers we met on the cruise wanted to stay at the Sheraton and they mentioned it was a two night minimum, which I found strange, so they must have been talking about the other Sheraton in Old San Juan. We booked through www.spg.com. Getting there from airport $18 + $1 per bag, came out to $20 Check In â€“ was efficient and fast Check Out â€“ We booked on Cash and Points and there was no mention of the $15 resort that came on the receipt under our door so upon check out we questioned that. We were told that the $15 is charged to everyone and it includes internet, pool towels etc, all stuff that already comes complimentary for Platinum members. So they will give you 500 more points for the resort fee, which means you are paying $15 for 500 points. For someone who already has a ton of points, paying for 500 more seemed a waste of money. Platinum members â€“ try to negotiate your way out of this if you donâ€™t need to collect another 500 points. Casino â€“ only has slot machines Convenience Store â€“ Hotel store has everything you probably need in the lobby with lots of drinks, souvenirs, chips, however wine and beer was a little expensive. I went looking for a Monster Drink (Red Bull) type of drink and there was none of that. So I googled a convenience store and we walked to a â€œ24 Expressâ€� about a 13 minute walk outside over the hill through a littered/almost sketchy area, but safe in the day time. We picked up all of the soda and drinks and wine we would need on the cruise ship for a fraction of the price. Foyer â€“ great vibe in the evening with music and lounge area Room â€“ Well we were seriously upgraded to a 1 bedroom King suite (both times) with 2 bathrooms, so our room was AMAZING! If you want a balcony suite with sunshine ask for Room 1101 - however that room is directly below the Club Lounge patio, so lounge guest can look down onto your balcony. We also had 1001 and since it had a roof, there wasnâ€™t much sunshine. Seems like all suites have a great view of the cruise ships and convention centre. Pool â€“ excellent facilities however both times we went down the service table for towels was un-manned and no towels. Frustrating â€“ you may want to bring your own towels from the bedroom down on busy days. Club Lounge â€“ beautiful view, HOWEVER â€“ extremely disappointing food options. As I mentioned we are Platinum, so have experienced a ton of Club Lounges and this by far was the worst! For breakfast, here is all that was available: coffee, tea, juice, red and green apples, muffins, bananas, mini boxes of cereal and bread for making toast. Happy Hour: Hummus with pita triangles (Hummus was gross with no flavour â€“ really needed some garlic or something added to it), mozzarella squares and cheddar cheese, deep fried local potato type wedges. Alcohol drinks were not complimentary. Soda: Coke, Diet Coke and Sprite. Thatâ€™s all. On our last day there upon check out we had planned to get the basic breakfast snacks and go have some cereal before our flight. We went at 8:30am only to find the doors open but no food was displayed. Others in the lounge said no one has been here all morning and there was never any food, so we were waiting for nothing. Very strange and definitely not like the Sheraton. If it was closed or had limited services, there could have posting on the doors to advise. Upon checkout we questioned the SPG desk about the lounge having no food and they said the service person didnâ€™t show up for their shift and that it was a holiday. The lounge opens at 6:30am, so you would figure by 8:30am there would be a replacement in place or at the bare minimum a sign posted. Getting to Cruise Port: The Front Desk told us the fare would be $7, so we were shocked that the price was double! $14 to go just over 1 kilometre, but most times you would have lots of luggage, so you would want to pay it. Itâ€™s totally possible to walk over in about 20 â€“ 30 minutes. Front desk should update their facts, or ask before you get into the taxi. The taxi driver explained that it was $10 + bags and fuel surcharge. Restaurants at Hotel: Texas De Brazil was attached to the hotel although we never went. There was also a new Mexican restaurant right outside called Ficus and it looked very popular. Getting to Old San Juan: Taxi is $13 One Service Issue: We were enjoying our suite and just wanted to hang out in our robes, so we called room service to bring us some ice. We were told that we have to go down the hall and get it ourselves. What a way to break the romantic snuggles on the couch. We totally would have tipped someone if they brought us ice, but I had to get presentable clothes on and trek down the hall with my ice bucket. Recommendation for the hotel: Add bringing ice to the room as a service . It would be neat if the Sheratons had a shuttle running between them, so you go to from the convention area to Old San Juan area and use both properties.

Reviews.Title: “Its about location and standards”
Reviews.Author: seechel
Reviews.Content: OK-- there were good and not so good on this hotel, lets start with not so good. Not so good: over priced for that is offered--which is very little. beautiful pool area but closes to early and the bar is wayyyy over priced. location is great if you dont want to leave the premises-- otherwise it gets costly by taxi or you will do alot of walking.... great housekeeping but they dont give you extras of anything... had to ask for TP and daily towels... very standard room and for only being 2 yrs old, looks worn already with some things.... didnt honor starpoint free breakfast and really didnt give much consideration to preferred members the good: beautiful views, modern decor, nice casino, 2 really good restaurants on site and one across the street, easy check in/out, good housekeeping, and valet staff great at helping with directions, luggage, taxis etc.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a family hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Slalch
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my children but it's not at all a family hotel. There is nothing for the kids other then the pool which closes at 8 pm. There is no pay per view movies in the room. No laundry or shuttle service. It's far from the beach and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for our vacation last month in March. This hotel is not in walking distance of Old San Juan, but that was not a problem for us at all. We took a 10 minute bus ride into Old San Juan everyday for just 50 cents. The buses run every 15 minutes and until 11pm and the bus stop is right at the corner of the hotel. The drivers and locals were all very helpful with leading us in the right direction. I've read some reviews that complained about the location of this hotel, but if you don't mind public transportation, it's not an issue. Otherwise, the cost of a taxi into Old San Juan is $15. The staff and concierge were all very helpful. They answered all of our questions with no problem. We paid for a balcony room with a view which wasn't worth the extra cost because the entire view was blocked by a gigantic tree. That wasn't an issue either since we spent no time in our room except to sleep. There were also a lot of mosquitos on the balcony. I'm assuming because of the tree. The food was extremely pricey here. We did not eat here at all. We got up every morning and hopped on a bus into Old San Juan and ate there everyday. We had an awesome time. There is a little mexican bar/restaurant called the Ficus directly across the street from the hotel with good food, $6 mojitos, and $5 glasses of Sangria. I ate and drank there 3 times and they stay open pretty late. Outside of that, there are no other places in the area. You'll find that this hotel is cheaper than some others, basically because of the location, but for 50 cents, you can head straight into Old San Juan in 10 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Family voted "Most likely to Return"”
Reviews.Author: weremovingonup
Reviews.Content: Based on the location of the hotel itâ€™s definitely worth having a rental car to get around at your own leisure. The arrival process was quick and simple, a very professional staff, special thanks to Managers Dominque Haacke and Jessica Rodriquez for your kind gestures and taking care of my family. The rooms are stylish, comfortable and most importantly clean, compliments to the housekeeping staff for having patience, always being courteous and extremely friendly. Although we experienced a situation during breakfast early in the stay, the restaurant managers Joseph Williams and Elsie Rosa were quick to make up for any missed opportunities while the serving staff Luis Posada and Julio Mojica made us feel like we were the only guests in the hotel all week. The infinity pool is amazing and endless rows of lounge chairs made pool time perfect, especially with server Enid Baevga, talk about anticipating needs, thank you Enid for sharing your smile each and every day! Our only complaint was the pool area closing at 8pm; it was tough looking down from the room at the empty jacuzzi after a long day of being out and about and wanting to relax. So by the show of hands, we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Splazzy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very trendy decor. The rooms are clean, and the hotel employees are courteous and helpful. BUT, this place is way overpriced. The rooms, while being very clean, are small. Also we ran out of toilet paper in the middle of night and didn't have an extra roll anywhere. No balcony. The infinity pool is nice, but full of little kids and it closes at 10 pm. It's about a $12-$15 cab ride to old San Juan, which isn't too bad. The restaurant across the street, ficus, is not bad either. Overall this is just a standard hotel with too big of a price tag. It doesn't have enough bells and whistles to justify the cost. Also, I booked on hot wire and got charged a "hotel service fee" of $15 per night to cover room amenities...I'm not sure what the $15 covers, as the room did not have any "amenities" above and beyond a standard hotel room. I would not stay here again, but only because it wasn't worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to relax before cruise!”
Reviews.Author: LofL
Reviews.Content: Stay here before you depart on a cruise if what you want to do while you're in San Juan is to relax in a huge American hotel. The only place in walking distance is an open-air bar Ficus that has live jazz on Saturday nights.Be sure to request a view of the harbor. We stayed in a Club room on the 12th floor; this gave us access to a veranda with views of the harbor as well as evening hors d'oeuvres and continental breakfast. Our room overlooked the fountain in front of the convention center, so after dark we could enjoy the light shows. Again, you will be pleased with your stay as long as this is the type of hotel experience you desire.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Clodypr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a couple times in this hotel and the food is always delicious. The last time I eat 3 times the same plate (steak frites) and Maria always brought me the food. She was very nice!! Thank u maria! The room was clean and the pool is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Experience at Choices Restaurant in Sheraton Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Natii N
Reviews.Content: My experience in this restaurant was completely excelent. Can't even think about one single complain. I highly recommend it and thank Elsie Rosa for her great job and charismatic service. The service of the staff, especially Ivan Amador, and the quality of the food were perfect and gave my family and I the kind of experience we were looking for. Beautiful decoration by the way. I would definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “VERY OVER PRICED, NOT FAMILY ORIENTED”
Reviews.Author: goldwingtravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not conveniently located. You are at their mercy for food and supplies... Breakfast was 23.00 per person.. dinner prices outrageous. Rooms were very nice and luxurious, very clean. We only stayed 1 night in order to catch Cruise ship next day. Consierge was very rude (twice). Luggage transfer went well. Just wish there were cafes, bistros, shops etc... that you could walk to to eat and purchase items. You need to catch a bus or cab to do so. Infinity pool was awesome... sunset best time to swim.. huge hot tub at 8pm with a drink in hand is awesome as well. Not a hotel for kids...infact we did not really see any children. Convention center is awesome to visit. Next time we will stay in Old San Juan for food and easy access to needs.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a few days on our way to the U.S.V.I. In hind sight we wish we had just stayed here and Puerto Rico longer instead of going to the Marriott Frenchman's Cove in the V.I. We enjoyed our stay at this Sheraton property very much, everyone was great, and we even won a little in the casino. BUT, this is a CONVENTION hotel, not a resort hotel which means it is a little more off the beaten track. If you want to be in more of the thick of things you may want to book at the Sheraton in Old San Juan. In either case, I would strongly recommend that if you are going through San Juan on your way to another location, spend a few days here and enjoy many of the things that Puerto Rico has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Simply outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: VMGA1234
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel at Hotwire for a week only paying around $875.00 for 7 days. A little apprehensive at the beginning but once we got here we were impressed with the hotel, services and staff. All very friendly. Asked for high floor overlooking the bay and got the 9th floor and "wow what a view". Swiming pool is very nice, hot tub really cool. One draw back is that I find the self service parking a bit far (across the street from the entrance and a few flights up) but well kept and very clean. Have not had the cha ve to do the casinos and restaurants yet as I am doing the local flavors. Will write another review as days go by.

Reviews.Title: “When you come to the Sheraton puerto Rico hotel and casino you must try "choices" restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Sleepybrowne76
Reviews.Content: There were several restaurants on the hotel premises but we decided to try out this one. We went here twice in a day and it was great. The Mofongo bouillabaisse was amazing. It is definitely something you have to try coming here. Also the burgers are great. Make sure when you stop by you ask for Julio he was a great server and treated us very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Old San Juan and Ships but service is hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: WJR-041
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two days and one night after a 7-day Southern Caribbean cruise. Be careful if coming off a cruise ship and ensure your bellman tells the cabbie that it is a short trip ... you can see the ships from the hotel and vice versa. Front desk service for restaurant or travel tips was non-existant, talk to the bellmen at the front as they are much more friendly and helpful. This is a new property (less than 2 years old), rooms are modern, clean, and spacious ... although the bathrooms are small in regular rooms. The gym is very good and the infinity pool, deck and bar (with food service) along with faux grass in parts is just a great place to chill before flying north back to reality. The Texas Brazil steakhouse (through the casino -- with great and recognizable slot and table games) is a fine treat ... just don't eat for the entire day before your meal. If we cruise back out of San Juan, this hotel will be near the top of our list, despite the hit and miss service now that we know our way around somewhat (after 3 trips to San Juan).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay at before the cruise”
Reviews.Author: traveler1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise - if you want to tour the city bus stops at the front door and a 5 minute ride gets you to the heart of the old city. The hotel has a casino and a couple of places to eat (treat yourself the the Brazilian steak house, a real treat) The pool deck is great, you can watch your cruise ship as it comes into the city as you swim in the pool

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: happy_campers_fla
Reviews.Content: our family stayed here for 5 days and loved it. I think it is closer to a W or Westin overall. It is new and very stylish. We had a bay view room which we loved. We could see the ships come in and the planes fly in on the private airport. Plus we could see the point at Conando so we got to see the ocean so we were very happy. The service was outstanding and the food in all of the restaurants was very good as well. The infinity pool on the 4th floor wass really pretty and the pool bar has very good drinks and food. The mexican restaurant Ficus across the street was good as well. It is 2 minutes for Conando and we thought the property was nicer than most of the ones we looked at. The only ding is the steel structure next door but hey everything else was amazing. We would definitely come back and recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “New, Comfortable, Pleased with Club Level”
Reviews.Author: Folkgroupie
Reviews.Content: Very nice new clean comfortable hotel. Bed very comfortable and room stylish. The hallways are some of the brightest prettiest I have seen in awhile. Breakfast excellent in hotel restaurant. Next to the convention center so not right in the action---but felt safer that way. Gym facilities excellent. CLub level good for snack at night which ended up being my dinner and access to soft drinks and snacks other times. Staff helpful. Good for business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Rooms, A Bit Removed from Rest of City”
Reviews.Author: Zeus S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really attractive and the lobby is jamming with music and good looking people strolling by. It's right next to the Convention Center and you can see the Cruise Ships docked across the bay. Our room was attractive and clean with an excellent bathroom. No complaints! The hallways are also clean and good looking. The patio deck is stylish with plenty of space. The Infinity pool is long and narrow. As someone else mentioned the water was unusually COLD. Took some getting used to. The pool was more of a hangout than a place to swim and place for kids. Speaking of kids, this hotel appears to cater more to adults than families with young children. Don't misunderstand me, what I'm trying to say is the hotel seem to attract a partying late 20's to 30's good-looking crowd. The lobby also has pumping music going. So you feel like you stepped into a nightclub. The rooms are plenty quiet and very comfortable, so young kid would have no issue with sleep. Food is overpriced but all these hotels tend to follow that strategy. If you don't have a rental car, that could be an issue. The hotel is located in area of San Juan that seems detached from the city. Old San Juan is good 15 minute drive away and some of the other 'hang out' destinations like Condado Beach are also not within walking distance. We had a rental car, so we were able to get out and go to different neighborhoods. Though will say parking and driving in San Juan is not for the meek. Locals don't cut you any slack. The workout facility is very nice and everything is new! There is a Resort fee of $15 a day. Again this is a common practice among larger hotels, but in this case you are actually getting a nice facility to use. My wife did forget her iPhone at the gym and surprisingly a staff member picked it up and held it for her and until she could return to recover it. What a relief that was!! Speaking of the staff, everyone we came in contact with was very helpful and pleasant. Definitely adds to the positive experience. They have a parking garage across street that cost $15 a day to park. You can go in and out if you choose to. Not inexpensive, but not horrible either. Overall, we had a very positive stay here! Would absolutely consider staying here again. Though would compare to a place in Old San Juan or Condado Beach as there are more options to get out and eat, sight-see without the use of a car or taxi. So it's a really nice hotel that requires a car or taxi to get around.

Reviews.Title: “First night here!!”
Reviews.Author: Lori P
Reviews.Content: Last night was our first night at the Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel & Casino and I have to say; so far it has met and exceeded our expectations. We were greeted by Miss Ridriguez, who is very personable and great at welcoming her guests (even our two children). She has been one of the sweetest, warmest and welcoming people I have ever encountered at any hotel I have ever stayed at, and we have stayed at several. We were given a balcony room on floor 8 with an amazing view. Victor was helpful with our all of our luggage and showing us around the facility, We called the front desk and requested more water, towels and a refrigerator and it was all brought up quickly. Later in the evening my kids received a special delivery from room service of fruit, cookies and milk. Ther perfect snack to a long day. After booking our stay here I was so nervous because of all the reviews and even considered cancelling. I am so grateful we decided to stay here and see what the facility had to offer. There isn't a lot to do around here but hopping on a bus is no problem at all. Everything is within a short ride from the hotel. I hope the remainder of our trip continues to be a success and memorable for our family! Thank you, Miss Rodriguez for welcoming us so warmly and being so helpful. Most importantly thank you for welcoming by children, they feel special which in turn makes me the happiest!! THANK YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: NorthwestCoaster
Reviews.Content: Upscale hotel with a great staff. Stayed here one night before our Princess cruise. Our ship was docked at the portside of this property and we walked to the boat to enjoy the weather rather than wait for our shuttle. Luggage was picked up from our room and delivered to the stateroom on the ship. Pool area is awesome with wonderful views, Our waitress at the pool offered great information about the San Juan area and excursions to take on our trip. Ate a late night snack at Ficus Mexican restaurant across the street. Cool place with a lively crowd next to the convention center. Grabbed a breakfast sandwich and coffee in the hotel lobby cafe before we checked out. Very good. No stores in the area but our stay was short so we didn't need one. If you want to spend time in Old San Juan, take a cab. They are everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excited”
Reviews.Author: couponmommal
Reviews.Content: Our family of four booked reservations for the Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel and Casino for March 26-29. After reading all of the reviews about not having much to do, not being kid-friendly and bad service I must say that I started to get a little nervous. But, this is our first family vacation and I am not going to let these reviews put a damper on our vacation. I hope (fingers crossed) that this vacation is going to be memorable for my kids and us as a family for so many good reasons and not because of a bad experience. Several customers have left some amazing reviews. I hope that we are greeted in the manner that most of you have been, get an amazing view in our room and are treated with dignity and respect as you all have been!! Don't let us down Sheraton!! Hopefully I can come back and leave a great review of our trip after we get back!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay "Pre-Cruise"”
Reviews.Author: WhenCanWeRetire
Reviews.Content: SHERATON PUERTO RICO HOTEL (not the Sheraton OLD town) Thank goodness we lucked in to this hotel for our "pre-cruise night". THIS IS THE HOTEL TO STAY IN! The POSITIVES: The hotel is extremely nice, great location to the cruise ships. Keep in mind there are 2 different sides of the port. Our RCCL ship actually happened to be on this hotels side of the port. Which ended up being "the correct" side to be on. Taxi's our cheap and convenience is everything. Very nice rooms: CLEAN, modern, quiet. The negative: "check-in process" the music was way too loud. We would stay here again and definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Going back but staying in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Textrav14
Reviews.Content: FIrst let me say, my wife and I had a blast in San Juan and are planning another trip back! As for this hotel, that's different. The hotel is brand new and has a lot of cool stuff. Like the nicest casino on the island. It's just like any other casino, it will eventually get your money. No gripes there, that's part of it. As for the other comment about the beaches being three minutes by car!?! What car were you driving? It was at least a $15 cab ride no matter where you want to go from this hotel. The ONLY thing to do on this side of the island is play in that casino. While we were there, the hotel had a LARGE private party in the main bar at the front entrance that could be heard in our room upstairs. Two days later it was closed for remodeling, so I never got to see it. We had decided to spend the day at the pool on a Monday morning, and they decided to drain the infinity pool! When I asked when it would be open again, it wouldn't be until the day after we left that it would be open. The food in the resturant on the first floor was lack lustre, at best, and that was breakfast. How do you make a lack lustre breakfast? That's the easiest meal of the day to cook. We tried eating in the Texas De Brazil resturant in the hotel. We have one at home and thought that it would be great to eat there too. Boy, were we wrong. The food was VERY salty and the service was not near what we had come to expect from the same resturant chain. The food variety and the salad bar were very much not the same and not near as plentiful. Our next trip is coming up this year and we have already made reservations at the hotel in Old San Juan, where EVERYTHING is located. The resturants, the clubs and the bars and yes, the other casinos. We can catch the bus there and take it to any of the beaches and not have to worry about cab drivers that don't take us where we want to go or the cancerns with getting a cab back.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice when staying in San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: msvattorney
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Sheraton PR Hotel & Casino were I spent three (3) nights. We choose this hotel because the rest of the hotels in PR were full and overpriced as result of spring break. Our rate was $169.00 plus tax for a double room with a view to the Isla Grande Airport and the Pan American Pier on the San Juan Bay. The hotel has an infinity pool facing the airport runway and you will not mind watching small planes and helicopters during take-off. Quite a sight to see while you are zipping a drink and floating in the hotels' infinity pool. You may even catch a fireworks show from one of the cruise ships at night. The rooms are modern and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the food at "Choices" is pretty good. You have two other restaurant choices; Texas do Brazil right on the Hotel and "Ficus" a mexican grill and cantina right accross from the hotel and the Puerto Rico Convention Center. You can walk around the "Dancing Fountain" (part of the PR Convention Center) while listening to Andrea Boccelli songs (mostly Fridays & Saturdays). Overall this a a great hotel situated in a great area. I'm definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “What an Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Dianne K
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on hotwire before we took our cruise. We wanted to be in the heart of Old San Jaun and this hotel was perfect. We arrived early in the morning as we had finished our cruise. The staff was very helpful when I mentioned I knew we were too early to check in, they told us they could store our bags until our room was ready. Since I was already there we could check in and they would call us when our room was done. We met our friends in the lobby and spent the day touring the forts and streets of Old San Jaun. The front desk called us in the afternoon to let us know our room was ready. Once we gathered our bags, keys etc we were very surprised to learn we had been upgraded to a suite. What a beautiful room! We even had a small balcony, a great place sit with morning coffee. We opted for the green program which gives you a $5 a day credit to use in the resturant. This means the maid is not making your bed or changing your towels, which was fine by us.We enjoyed a wonderful breakfast on the last day of our stay in the morning room. Everything was great, the staff, the maids, the pool area, and even the casino was generous to me. What an Anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, nothing around it”
Reviews.Author: Jayla78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise. The lobby was stunning, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool deck was exceptional, beautiful views, gorgeous eternity pool... the only problem? The pool was a little cold for my tastes :) There really is nothing around this hotel other then the convention center. You must cab it to stores or restaurants. The prices of food at this hotel (probably because they are a monopoly) are INSULTING. It is the one HUGE negative for this hotel. And the wait staff really don't seem to care about checking up on you, getting you refills, or even really getting you a beer. We were lucky that another couple had found a little restaurant that had just opened called Ficus right next to the Sheraton where we got great food, for great prices. i would stay here again in a heartbeat.... now that I know about Ficus. Between the quality of the hotel, and now not having to pay their restaurant prices, it is certainly worth taking a look. ** We did forget a jacket at this hotel, and when we returned from our cruise we stayed at the Sheraton OSJ, we called over at 830 am. They said they would send it right over. Well after 3 more phone calls, with promises of it being sent over right away, they finally told us they wern't going to send it, we had to pay for a cab to go get it. It wasn't so much having to pay for the cab, as it was the all day "it's coming" only to be told at 430pm, oh no you have to come and get it.....

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Great for Adults with OUT children”
Reviews.Author: JAXTRAVELLINGMOM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and appears new. They have 3 places to eat and a casino. There is not one area in the hotel that caters to children. When I booked I let the agent from Sheraton know that I had a 2 & 4 year old. They assured me it would be ok. Even the pool was more for adults. A small affinity pool on top of a building and a large Jacuzzi that children can not go in for safety reasons of course. There is not a children's pool area at all. The food was over priced and did not even taste that good for what we had ordered. Now let me get to what I had the major issue with! My bedding had old blood on it form the previous guest. I called the front desk 5 times to have new bedding sent me. 2 hours later I called for a manager and finally someone came up and threw a new comforter and sheets to put on myself! I called back and asked if that is standard and they said no and offered free breakfast. Wow!!! Not much customer service there. Especially when I paid over 200.00 a night plus parking. Also, I stayed on the 10th floor and it smelled like a dirty diaper when I got off of the elevator every day. I called and reported the smell twice and nothing was ever done. No fridge in the room either. This hotel is also not on the beach and does not have a nice view out of the window. Sits on top of the modern looking convention center. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton San Juan by ship piers”
Reviews.Author: rick416
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, which is across the street from the San Juan convention center the day prior to a cruise. It's about a $25 to $30 cab ride from the airport. The lobby was nice, as was the room, although, the room was a bit on the small side. As previously noted, prices at the hotel are expensive. At the bar, mixed drinks were about $10, and wine was in the $9 to 10 range. A hamburger at the grill was $15. Breakfast for two was about $35 to 40, although you could easily spend more. A cab ride to the cruise ship pier, which was less than a mile, was $12 with luggage. All of these prices are without tip. In addition, the hotel is not close to much of anything, other than the convention center. There was a small mexican restaurant across the street, but no other nearby restaurants. Finally, an ATM in the lobby ha a $3.50 charge while the ATM in the casino only had a $1.50 charge. However, neither ATM was working when we were there. Overall, the hotel and people were nice, but not extraordinary. I wouldn't go out of my way to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: Oscar C
Reviews.Content: Why do people complain about the distance from the beach!! its 3 mins by car ..WOW!!!! The hotel is almost brand new and the casino is great!! I went to three other casino's and they were in the hotels such as the MARRIOTT.. Those casinos were old and no one was winning at all!!.. The first night in the sheraton I played $5 and won $1032.. Then the next 3 nights $500, $450 and $700.. The rooms are great!! I love the cruise ships ... The pool was great!! the only complaint is the price of the room service $$$ ex: 13 wings for $15 or Burger for $17 !!!!! .. and yes you will need a car to get to all the resturants .. unless u walk 3 mins to sizzler everyday

Reviews.Title: “Massive improvement over prior stays”
Reviews.Author: brxbmrzfan
Reviews.Content: Third stay at the property...but, first in over a year. Service levels at the hotel have substantially improved. During my first two stays, the club lounge was inexplicably closed. It was opened this stay and is a real asset to the property. It is a beautiful space on the top floor with both inside and outside space. There is great food and a very nice coffee/cappacino/latte machine. Beer/wine is available for a charge. There is a refrigerator that is regularly stocked with bottle water (free). I love the location because it is close to Condado (within walking distance) but not in Condado. There is also ample free street parking. I am a Platinum member and was upgraded to a great suite. Housekeeping was very friendly and my room was perfect every day. What a great stay! And, great value to the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Far Away Place/Expensive food and drinks”
Reviews.Author: Sonny A
Reviews.Content: Nothing great about this place.Parking $16 day,beer $7.50+tip,breakfast $20,mysterious fee $15 a day,bad room service.Cab ride to old san juan and condado beach is $25+ round trip.Airport taxi $40 round trip.Please stay away until they operate a free shuttle to airport,old san juan and the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “A 2.5-3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: cookpias
Reviews.Content: Great facilities, but needs improvements to be the 4-star hotel it claims to be. Regular supervision by housekeeping and maintenance needed. We had 6 rooms after a cruise. Rooms cleaned very inconsistently with trash cans unemptied, floors not vacuumed and glasses not cleaned or replaced. Half of our doors did not firmly close and an 80+ year old in our group had a stranger walk into her room. Panels in bathroom and near elevators obviously in need of repair. Room service trays in hallway more than a day. Front desk understaffed at times leading to 10-15 minute waits even just to get new keys.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: rita000000607985
Reviews.Content: hotel is beautiful -- rooms are amazing. the pictures on this site does not justice to them.. one bad thing - pool closes at 9pm .. apart from that if youre going solely for the beach- realize its 10 minutes away by cab --15$ Isla Verde is the street with hotels/resturants that are on the beach. or OLD san juan which also has a sheraton i dont know if its as nice-- this hotel has a magnificent view--highly recommend it -- but if youâ€™re going for the beach ISLA verde will save you money from taxi drivers

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for business at the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Carldaddy
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel directly across the street from the Convention Center and it is perfect if you are attending or working an event being held there. The rooms are basic Sheraton, clean comfortable and well furnished. The beds are comfortable, linens and towels decent, and there is in room coffee. Sound proofing is ok, although because of the ventilation gap at the bottom of the door hallway traffic is quite audible. I would suggest a room well removed from the elevators if you are a light sleeper as neighbors returning from the casino or nightclubs can be loud. This gap also lets in a good bit of light, which when combined with all the electronics can make the room seem well lit in the middle of the night, even with the light blocking curtains drawn. The pool area is very nice, and the poolside restaurant is also a nice place for lunch. There is a Texas de Brazil franchise restaurant on the far side of the casino, A Sushi place in the center of the casino and a sit down restaurant off the lobby. Food is also served at both of the lobby bars as well, with the offerings are pretty much at all the outlets. The casino seems larger and more active than some other hotels I have stayed in San Juan, and it also seems like a lot of local players so it has a nice â€˜other countryâ€™ vibe to it.. There is also an outdoor Mexican restaurant/nightclub on the plaza between the hotel and the convention center that has live music and good food. Aside from the offerings in the hotel, and this one Mexican place there is not a lot to do in the convention district. It will be a $14.00 cab ride to Old San Juan or Condado. If you do go to Old Town, driving is a nightmare and parking is worse so take a cab and have fun. Saturday night on Paseo La Princessa is worth a visit. A wide boulevard packed with families and couples strolling past street musicians, jugglers and vendors, and music everywhere, it is San Juan at its best.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a local and I'm telling you DON'T stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Ceniza11
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the fact that I LIVE in Puerto Rico, so I know a thing or two about the hotels here.I stayed here for a couple of nights after getting one of deep discounts websites. Let's get a couple of positives out of the way..nice view of the bay/cruise ships, pretty pool. Nice room (but I was on the Preferred guest level). Food is good at the hotel main's restaurant. Now, let's get to all the reasons why this hotel is just WRONG! First, the hotel says its 4 stars. ALL 4 star hotels in Puerto Rico are on the beach. THIS one is not!!! Plus, they don't even have free shuttle to/from the beach. The pool closes at 800pm Sunday-Thursday and at 1000pm on Friday and Saturday. WHY would you do that if you don't have a beach??? At least let people enjoy the pool whenever they want, especially those coming back LATE from conventions!! The hotel is NOT close to anything if you don't know the area. Everything that is close you either won't be able to find or depending on the day/time may take you up to an hour to get there since San Juan/Condado traffic can get really nasty especially on nights/weekends. Last but not least and probably what turned me off the most!! I extended and paid for an later check-out because I was working and had gone to bed late the night before. Since I couldn't stay in the room after 1pm, I went downstairs and while I was checking out told the front desk clerk that I wanted to use their business center so I could work until the end of the day. He said absolutely not, because since I checked out I wouldn't be "allowed"on their computers. When I mentioned I had a laptop, he said I wouldn't be able to connect because they couldn't give me a password!! This is probably one of the most outrageous things I've ever heard from a hotel. It completely soured every other possibly good thing I had to say about the hotel and I vowed that I would never come back and would NOT recommend! They literally kicked me out even from something as commonly used as a business center! PLEASE!! There are so many other beautiful, great service hotels here in the island,..DON'T go to the Sheraton Convention Center!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, 26 Feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: bs4u2c
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for two different nights through Hotwire. The first night was the night before our cruise we arrived at the 1:00 PM. We were told that they had over booked the hotel and had no rooms, the staff was very nice and accommodating, they had tried to contact me earlier but we were in the middle of a two week vacation. They made arrangements for us at the Wyndham about 45 minutes to an hour away. The Sheraton paid for the taxi each way, it turned out that we had the opportunity to see more of the island at the hotelâ€™s expense. The night that we did stay was 26 Feb 2012. We just finished our cruise, our flight was the next day. Arrived at the hotel around 9:00 AM, they allowed us to check- in, but our room wouldnâ€™t be ready until later, they would call me on my cell phone when it was, so we checked our luggage with the bell boy and caught a bus, near the hotel for 75 cents each way. It was a five minute ride to Old San Juan. I received a phone call around 12:30 PM that our room was ready so we did a little more shopping and headed back to the hotel. The room was on the 11th floor overlooking the bay, it was a beautiful view, and a great room. The staff was great, the hotel was nice and location was convenient for us. We would defiantly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: jflythe
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean and comfortable. The restaruants and bars were exceptionally expensive but the food was not exceptionally good. I was on a business trip. Unfortunately, the service for towels, wash cloths, and normal amenities were scarce. We had to call the front desk often after the room was "serviced" but left no towels, bathmats, or washcloths. Tips were "included" in our price although the service was never performed. The view from our window was across the bay looking toward the ocean - beautiful. Be prepared if you go! It is next to the convention center wtih nothing else around it but a view half a mile away.

Reviews.Title: “I can only echo many of the other comments.”
Reviews.Author: grcooper
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel near the sights - keep looking. We just returned from a 4-night stay, for a convention, at this Sheraton. The hotel was very nice and the room was exceptionally clean. If you want to go to old San Juan there is a bus system that picks up from the nearby convention center for only 75 cents, each way. The only disappointment was the cost of the food and drink but you have no where else to go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but close to nothing”
Reviews.Author: relaxation-hound
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton in February 2012. The hotel is beautiful with a view of the convention center and cruise ships. You can see Old San Juan from the pool deck. The pool deck is huge with plenty of space to lounge. Beautiful infinity edge pool. Nice decor in the room, very clean. Overall this is a very comfortable hotel. The con is that the hotel is in the middle of nowhere. There are no restaurants in walking distance, so you're stuck ordering room service or eating at the pool or at the hotel looby restaurant, Choices. There is a Texas de Brazil on the block with the hotel and a Ficus across the street. Don't eat at Ficus, bland Mexican food is a problem..Old San Juan is a hike from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel not great for vacation”
Reviews.Author: Deepfin
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling on business on a extended stay business trip, this hotel is comfortable and well maintained. The facility is beautiful with a very nice pool deck and nice HOT Jacuzzi. If you want a beach PR feel I would recommend elsewhere. The location is not the best. It truly is intended to facilitate convention goers. The taxis in PR are now charging you 15 dollars for a one minute cameo appearance. It costs the same to take a cab to old San Juan 5 minutes than taking a cab from the airport. This was unfortunate because the hotel is walking distance from NOTHING. Over all the staff in hotel very nice unlike elsewhere in PR where they have almost en entitlement mentality (taxi drivers) and give mediocre service and expect excellent tip. I would stay here again on a business trip but a bit spendy if you are trying to watch your expenses. I would recommend the embassy suites instead.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: kyfe
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire who "mistakenly" gave me the convention centre and not the Sheraton in Old San Juan. They told me to take it up with Sheraton and see if we could switch, when we got here I inquired and was told this is up to hotwire and there was nothing they could do. They offered an upgrade to a nicer room but given that we are only here for one night and specifically wanted to see San Juan it was kind of pointless. Either way we accepted and they took my number so we could spend the day in old San Juan while the room was being prepared. No Call ever came, our upgrade was to a handicapped accessible room (neither of us are in need of such a room) with no bath and no alarm clock/ipod dock. Needless to say for one night it was a bunch of missed opportunities to make us happy and added expenses to see the city. I fail to understand why they cannot offer a shuttle to the other Sheraton which would have made ours and from the reviews many others stays' more tolerable. The hotel is nice and in the middle of NOWHERE. Free internet is nice. Cab rides are $12-15 into old San Juan each way the rooms are modern looking but without anything important to most travellers like a fridge or an alarm clock. a $15 resort fee? WTF? there are no resort facilities Super disappointed that we were forced to stay at the wrong Sheraton and even though it's the same company and we were willing to pay extra, nobody would entertain the option and help us see if something could be done to get us in Old San Juan. Unfortunately I cannot recommend this hotel unless you need a bed for the night and do not plan to see old San Juan, you are stranded and stuck paying silly taxi fees to travel such a short distance to the old town, use the money to book in the city and enjoy the beautiful city. I just hope we can avoid the extra billing charges

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nonnita02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a pre-cruise. I was concerned after reading some negative feedback here, but, it was a great place to stay. We had pre-paid our stay & everything went very smooth. Beautiful building, right across the Convention Center. Everybody was very helpful, and we got a great room, spacious, including free Wi-Fi. The area of the Pool, located on the Fourth Floor, was perfect to take pictures. Good breakfast buffet to please everybody. The check out with RamÃ³n NuÃ±ez was flawless. I would stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: SandyRiver
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire, and spent a fraction of the price of the hotels in Old San Juan. Beautiful infinity pool overlooking the harbor (where the cruise ships doc), and a pleasant spot for lunch or poolside drinks. Service exceptionally nice from all staff we met. Breakfast buffet OK but pricy. Rooms lovely, except for the strange way they made the bed, with the bottom sheet about a foot short of the end of the bed. If we had stayed another night I would have said something to housekeeping. Thought it was a fluke, but noticed our daughter's room had the same thing. Took a cab to Old San Juan to go sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pool area!”
Reviews.Author: BananaC0lada
Reviews.Content: We ended up with this hotel via Hotwire.com - and the hotel completely exceeded our expectations and we got great value for money. The pool area is resort style - loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to spend a few days prior to a Caribbean cruise”
Reviews.Author: Jacquie396
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in Puerto Rico before embarking on our Caribbean cruise and found this hotel to be very good value. We booked using our BCAA membership so the room was affordable as well as comfortable and in a good location...close to the cruise ship pier and easy access to visit Old San Juan. The hotel has a roof top pool area that is quite large with a patio bar/snack bar and lots of lounge chairs. Staff were generally friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was expensive so would not recommend. All in all, we found it a good place to catch some sun and relax before heading out on our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: Mimi_Camejo
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here after our wedding for two nights before going to St Martin and we were so pleased with the experience, it was better than expected. We had asked for an early check in and we were aware that early check in is subject to availability but I called the day before to make sure that it could be available so that I could get ready at the hotel before the wedding. The night manager Angel was very customer oriented and willing to help and Mariela Cintron from sales who took care of every detail. On our check in day, we did get the room earlier with enough time to prepare before the wedding. The hotel was full, so i am really appreciative of how Mariela and Angel accommodated us; it ended up being better than expected with an exquisite room. The 2nd floor has beautiful spots to take great pictures, unfortunately i didn't get to see the 2nd floor until after the wedding day, so I was bummed that we didn't get pictures taken there.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but a bit off”
Reviews.Author: FlashPackerSandy
Reviews.Content: Professional service. Unnescessary expensive breakfast alternatives. The quesadilla in the lobby bar/restaurant was nice, and there's a happy hour as well. Didn't visit the casino next to the lobby. The room was okay, we slept well. Just 100 m away you'll find the convention centre, where you also find the bus to the center (no 21 "express" and no 53 a bit slower). Make sure you have exactly 75 cent since you cannot get change on the bus. Across the street from the hotel you'll find Avis rental service (which we were extremely NOT happy with but maybe you have better luck - noone in the office even within opening hours, discussion about the insurances..) and also a cafÃ© which wasn't open when we were there, but I guess it is later on. Except for the breaktfast cafÃ© we liked the staff, and they were professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a few small issues.”
Reviews.Author: LeonMart
Reviews.Content: This is a sparkling, beautiful new hotel situated about 5 minutes from Old San Juan. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, and nicely appointed but there are no in room movies and TV channel options are terrible. The pool facilities are among the best I have experienced. The hotel restaurants are quite pricey and there are absolutely no other food options ( especially breakfast) near the hotel. If you rent a car, be prepared for a huge parking hassle. The hotel charges a daily parking fee, but each time you come and go from the parking garage, you must get a new ticket and take it to the parking garage window and advise them of your room number. The attendant validates it and you feed the ticket into the machine and repeat this every time you leave and return. The repeat trips to the window are tiresome.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied....”
Reviews.Author: PennyMinnesota
Reviews.Content: I would totally agree with FX01 as for a good hotel before or after a cruise. We were able to book this hotel through Priceline bidding during San Sebastian festival for a pretty good price, so were pleased. We were a family of 10 booking three rooms, with kids, and they loved the pool and whirlpool...in January. Yes, it is away from the crowds of Old San Juan and the beaches, but we knew we wouldn't have time to sit at a beach anyway. We did take the bus into Old San Juan and found no problem with that. It was actually fun coming back from the festival with a busload of singing Puerto Ricans! We liked to order lunch at the cafe by the pool, prices were okay and less than the regular restaurants, it seemed. We didn't bother with the casino. We were only there for two nights but it worked out well for our purposes. It's a new hotel and our kids thought it was "fancy".

Reviews.Title: “bad spot for vacationers”
Reviews.Author: justsomeone
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, terrible location. For that reason alone, I wouldn't stay here unless I had something going on at the convention center next door or I was flying in the night before a cruise. I hate to say that because the hotel actually is really nice, but if you want to go to the beach, do some sightseeing or eat out, forget it. Or, prepare to spend an extra $50. The bus stops outside, but the service is terrible. You can wait forever. You wind up taking a taxi, and the cabbies have quite a scam going. Plan on spending at least $20 for the ride even if you're only going a mile, and that's no exaggeration. The one time the meter ran, on a trip to the airport, the thing was going faster than an Indy car. It's an absolute ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Pre and post-cruise stay, will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: FX01
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in Feb 2012. One night prior to departing on our 7-day cruise and one night upon our return to San Juan. 9th floor room on the first night and 12th floor room on the second night. In general the staff was excellent, very polite and helpful. The king bed rooms were very nice, and surprisingly, very quiet as the lobby area and casino were really hopping both nights. We spent one afternoon, post cruise, on the pool deck, which is very nice and overlooks the piers. The pool deck bar/grill is good, service was quite fast and the lunch there was very good. Post cruise, our ship arrived fairly early in the morning so our room was not ready when we arrived at the hotel. It was about a three hour wait but we spent much of it on the pool deck, enjoying drinks and lunch, so the wait did not seem excessive. As it was, we had our room by 1 PM which is three hours before the normal check in time. The 12th floor room overlooked the pool deck and piers and had a wonderful view, very nice. The only down side to the whole experience was the price of food, but I think that is probably understandable as this is a resort/convention center venue. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel for pre- and/or post-cruise lodging. We were very happy with our stay. We would definitely stay here again for our next cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Terri Z
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one day before my cruise. It was very nice. We were quickly and courteously greeted. The check-in line was short and we were quickly taken to our room. The room itself was very nice, clean, and attractive. The beds were comfortable and I really liked the iPod docking station in the room. The food was very expensive (two bagels, two cups of coffee = $14.00); lunch at the poolside grill: $15.00 for a burger with fries. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The casino is not Vegas-big, but still, offered a variety of machines and tables. Check out was quick and efficient. All in all, an enjoyable stay. Good security as one could not go to one's floor by elevator without inserting your room key to confirm that you should be going there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: RRanella
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in San Juan Puerto Rico prior to going on our Royal Caribbean Cruise early February, 2012. The prices for food / drinks were very expensive. Be ready to pay $4.00 for a cup of coffee, $15.00 for continental breakfast & $18.00 for the all American breakfast which included coffee, juice, eggs, home fries / bacon. There were a few restaurants nearby within walking distance. Los Pinos Restaurant (Puertorrican) 655 Ponce de Leon Ave Miramar, Lima Restaurant (Peruvian) 667 Ponce de Leon Ave Miramar, Osaka Restaurant (Japanese) 670 Ponce de Leon Ave Miramar & Punta Del Este (Argentinean) 906 Ponce de Leon Ave Miramar, San Juan Puerto Rico. Thereâ€™s no shopping / things to do nearby. So, we decided to visit Old San Juan. (((FYI))) Even thou you could get a cab down the street from the hotel, Its best to have the bellman flag one down for security reasons. The hotel is equipped with outside cameras, which documents you, the cab & driver. It costs $12.00 to go to Old San Juan, one way, approx. 10-15 minute ride. The only pro I could give the hotel is itâ€™s a short distance to the pier, 5 minutes. If we decide to go back to Puerto Rico, we will stay in the Condado area (Ashford Avenue) where there are many restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: yvette7777
Reviews.Content: This holiday season, my daughter and I visited Puerto Rico. We stayed at the Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel and Casino and had a fabulous time. The staff was absolutely wonderful, especially Grissel Rivera. She made us feel warm and welcomed from the moment we entered the hotel. She answered our questions about the island, transportation and even restaurants. Eduardo was outstanding. The service he provided was exceptional. The hotel was just beautiful and we loved the peaceful location which is away from the hustle and bustle, but just a short 75 cent bus ride to the action. We look forward to returning to the Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel and Casino again soon. Thank you for making our vacation spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great but isolated!”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie1111
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, very cleann, big room, pool area outstanding. Great view on the cruise ships and close by if your leaving for a cruise. But, if you want to go to another restaurant than the one on site (Brazillian steak & breakfast), you will have to walk 10-15 minutes or take a taxi.We did walk to the Condado area, about 15-20 minutes, small beachs, lots of restaurant and boutiques. The construction projets in the area of the hotel did not lift, so its kind of alone out their.

Reviews.Title: “Near convention center newer clean hotel need a rental car to go anywhere though”
Reviews.Author: travelz4biz
Reviews.Content: Check in was painful booked a king bed they only had doubles. After a lot of fuss they actually had king beds so that was not cool to have to fight for the room you booked and paid for. The service remained the same all week it was terrible. Rooms are new, very comfy beds, bathrooms clean, tv and good wifi! Executive lounge - nice view and deck to retreat to. Food slection was very skinny and drinks are extra cash bar sort of thing Pool and hot tub looked great too busy to try and fitness room was well equipped! 2 restaurants on site texas brazil bbq place open for dinner $45 per plus plus but good treat! The other place never tried but was in the lobby. Rest you have to drive 10-15 min or cab to get some good grub! If you are in town for the convention then stay here as it is next door. If you going for holidays stay at Isla Verde or Rio Grande Had it not been for the bad service they would have got a better rating

Reviews.Title: “Next to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: we B travlin'
Reviews.Content: Out travel agent booked this hotel for us. After reading the reviews here for it, I was quite apprehensive. However, I feel a lot of reveiwers are much too picky. We stayed there prior to our cruise departure. From a quick check-in thru a quick check-out, everything went smooth. The room was very nice, clean & quite, over-looking the pool, convention center and Saturday morning our much-anticipated cruise ship just across the way! Talking with the little gal at the car rental stand, we learned about the festival in Old San Juan. She was sweet, helpful & informative. We got a bus in front of the Convention Center, just across the street, and went to town. Our luggage was taken care of for us the next morning and our transportaion to the ship was pleasantly executed. Yes, I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Costadellappers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight prior to boarding our Cruise ship. The check in was efficient and the staff friendly. The rooms are beautifuly appointed and ours had a fantastic view over the port.

Reviews.Title: “Slow Service and unfriendly front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Courtney R
Reviews.Content: prior to my stay I read the reviews on Trip Advisor and almost changed my reservations. I decided to give it a try that hopefully I would have a better experience. Well upon arrival there was a line at check in. We waited an hour to get checked in. That is unacceptable! If I was the manager and saw this line in my establishment I would have put all hands on deck to help customers. There were people at the front like the concerige (not busy) who did not offer to help. The individual running the perferred line allowed a individual to just walk in front of everyone else. Once we got to the front it still took forever. It is a shame this is your first experience because the facility although not close to anything is beautiful. The pool and bar area are wonderful and the bartenders were great. If Sheraton would train theri front desk on the systems and customer service it would be a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JKW2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton on Convention Blvd for one night before we left out on a Caribbean Crusie. The cruise port we were cruising from was right across the way from the hotel, so it made it very convenient for us. We arrived at the hotel in the evening and the front desk staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. They upgraded us to a wonderful room on the 4th floor that had a balcony. The view of the bay was outstanding from our balcony and when we woke up the next morning we had an amazing view of our cruise ship. The hotel offers a casino (which I can't speak on b/c we didn't play any while we were there), but there was a lot of activity going on. We tried out all of the bars including the pool bar. All of the bartenders were very nice to meet and talk with. There is actually a sushi bar in the casino that was very good. There was live music in the lounge and two upscale restaurants to choose from along with a grill for burgers and such at the pool area. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The staff was so nice and helpful, the food was good, the drinks were strong, the hotel rooms and common areas were very new, clean and well kept. The pool area was so relaxing and pretty to have as part of your view from your room. It was a little pricey compared to what we are used to, but it was comparable to all the other hotels in the area. We will stay here when we visit San Juan again!

Reviews.Title: “First Class place to stay”
Reviews.Author: slotboss
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is in the middle of everything in San Juan. Close to airport, Old San Juan, and Plaza Las Americas Mall. The Hospitality of the staff was first class at every turn. Can't go wrong if you choose the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Looks like new”
Reviews.Author: TPGCMH
Reviews.Content: Front desk and concierge gave us great service. Everything looked new. Enjoy Starwood hotels, and this one looked new. Quick taxi ride to Old San Juan, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for pre-cruise stay, but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: JAMAICALUVRS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton on 12/24 and 12/25 prior to sailing out of San Juan on a holiday cruise. The hotel is nice, clean, comfortable...but expensive! the buffet breakfast is nice, but it was $23 per person. We ordered 1 hamburger and fries to be delivered to our room and it was $25. The hamburger and fries was $15, the rest was their room service fees, they added in their own tip, etc. The hotel like others mentioned is off on its own, you can walk to Condado Beach area or Ashford St, it takes about 15 minutes or so. Cab rides are about $12 to the Old San Juan area...so I highly suggest getting some quarters and taking the bus for $.75 each person/each way to the Old San Juan area. You can easily catch the bus right in front of the convention center and they come around quite often and it was easy!! We took the bus to the Old San Juan area and it was alot of historical sites, we enjoyed walking all around the area. I will also caution you, as my husband and I found out...we were walking along the bay in front of the El Murro fort. It comes to a dead end, it doesn't go all the way around and it is a pretty lengthy walk...but it also opens up and rains, hard, at times...we got all the way to the end, realized it didn't go all the way around, turned around to come back and it poured down rain. Needless to say we were soaked!! but otherwise it is a nice area to walk around...

Reviews.Title: “Generic Sheraton in Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: hook'emMidwest
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Sheraton PR Hotel and Casino adjacent to the San Juan Convention Center for two nights and would caution against this property for most visitors to San Juan. There's nothing particularly wrong with the hotel itself. It's a generic Sheraton: check in was fast and smooth, rooms identical and dull, mediocre and expensive food ($30 for a room delivery pizza, $6 bottle of beer), etc. The main problem is that it's in a bad location unless one is attending events at the convention center. Old San Juan is across the harbor ($15 cab ride each way: $16 per day if you self-park your own car) and there is nothing (really, nothing) of interest within walking distance of the hotel. This Sheraton is an isolated, somewhat industrial (docks, small airport) area, and there's little about the property that would distinguish it from a Sheraton in Atlanta or Chicago or Indianapolis...

Reviews.Title: “sad but true”
Reviews.Author: brenda m
Reviews.Content: stayed here 12-11-11 to 12-13-11 chilling hard by the pool, noticed ph battery was low and decided to charge it. ordered food enjoyed cocktails and in a moment it disappeared...also don't park on the yellow lines, even though thats where valets park, you will get a $15 ticket same as using their parking :l

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Dee F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise. The staff was outstanding from the moment we got out of the taxi as we were about to check in until we checked out the next day headed to the cruise port. Eduardo and I had a long conversation about why my husband and I were vacationing and I mentioned that it was our 10 year wedding anniversary. Within 2 hours of checking in (which was amazingly smooth), someone delivered a complimentary bottle of wine and snack tray with a note from Eduardo. We vowed, at that moment, that we would stay at this hotel when we returned to San Juan. The hotel room was spacious and we had a great view of the mountains and of the water. The breakfast buffet the next morning was great, too. We had an great stay!!! Thanks, y'all!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel double charges its customers”
Reviews.Author: AMB186338
Reviews.Content: I booked and paid for this hotel via British Airways to stay one night in Puerto Rice prior to a cruise, and upon check-in presented the voucher to the desk clerk. The following morning, I received a copy of the bill pre-checking out including the pre-paid room charges. I queried this only to be told that BA hadn't honoured the payment and I would have to pay again. The desk clerk made it my problem to resolve, which I did by phoning British Airways who said they would contact the hotel's accounting department to explain their invoicing policy. After breakfast it was apparently resolved, I received a new bill without the room charges and left. However on returning to the UK I checked my credit card account, only to find that the Sheraton went ahead and billed me for the difference despite having handed me a revised bill. Shame on them. Two weeks later I'm still resolving this with my credit card company and British Airways - the Sheraton has yet to respond to either, and in the meantime I've paid twice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Club Lounge, But Limited Food”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: My first stay at this hotel. It is isolated with nothing nearby except the Convention Center. Yet, the hotel may be all you need as it has a casino, infinity pool with a huge deck to get a tan or a drink, 3 good (not great) restaurants, a fitness center, and a large lobby. I spent time in the 24 hour club lounge with indoor/outdoor views and TVs and couches and 2 computers with printers. Simple, limited food served at breakfast and dinner. Taxis were plentiful. About 15 minutes from the airport and 15 minutes from Old San Juan. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: EddieO1
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was great. I would have given it a five out of five rating if not for the hugely unrealized potential and for the somewhat isolated location. This place could rock if it catered to a hipper clientele. The rooms are solid Sheraton, with only a few housekeeping detail glitches, easily curable. The bright common areas are crowned by the modern 4th floor endless pool and the free wi-fi goes well with the business crowd. Choices, the restaurant, I thought was the best part of the hotel and hope will remain so with the upcoming chef's departure for the St Regis. We will definitely return, I miss it already.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: baunach49
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3-nights, the rooms are of a good size and our room had a balcony. Unfortunately sitting out on the balcony my Wife got badly bitten by mosquitos. I would have thought a hotel of this category would have undertaken spraying to overcome this issue. The food at the restaurant is of good quality but the choice is very very average, it appears no or very little thought has gone into the menu choice. Breakfast is poor and very expensive, and that includes the weekend buffett. Getting served in the Bar are is a "nightmare" I had to complain on two different days, as the bar staff have their "favourites" whilst ignoring newcomers !! Complaint handled well but never should have got that far ! The Hotel is isolated and the location description is somewhat mislead. You need transport !! would I recommend staying here ? Definately NO, would I stay here again ? definately NOT

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO STAY IN SAN JUAN!!”
Reviews.Author: willy72
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and Casino for almost 10 days and it was one of the best vacations and places I've ever stayed. It is located in one of the most central parts of San Juan! It's a short taxi or bus ride to Old San Juan, walking distance to the beach and if you don't want to leave, there are pools and places to eat right there! The rooms are roomy and up to date. If you wanted to spend an entire day in the room, room service and movies are excellent! We'll be going back!

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED AND TERRIBLE FOOD”
Reviews.Author: Rich M
Reviews.Content: I am visiting the Puerto Rico for my first time and my travel agent booked my stay at the Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel & Casino. The hotel breakfast is HORRIBLE. Food was cold, pricey...OVERPRICED...for some cold eggs, cold toast, and minute maid potatoes. Let's not forget they gave me a glass with some lipstick still on it from a previous customer and dirty silverware with some food still on it from a previous customer. Customer service seems adequate. Casino is a Slaughter house. They have 2 Blackjack tables and 3 slot machines and call this a casino. Hell Nah..I thought I would atleast walk into a mini casino. My stay here is not worth discussing any further. Very disappointed. If you can stay at a place that offers more for less. I HIGHLY recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're at a Convention a little far out for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: knautmoore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a quick get away from Tampa FL and we always have good luck at Sheraton. This hotel with a casino was also very nice. The restaurant menu was better than we expected and that was a good thing as it was a $13 cab ride into Old San Juan every time we wanted to go which added a lot to a meal. The bus would have been fine but there was a tropical storm dumping rain making long walks a bit hazardous. The Front Desk people arranged a trip to the Rain Forest and when things turned a little bit to Gilligan's Island and the driver left our group off at the beach and disappeared I had to call them because everything had been closed due to the weather. They got the Tour People immediately and we were rescued! The one morning I stayed behind in the room for a bit the maid came in and took pity on me and my over indulgence in Island food. She just went and brought me tea and honey! What a honey! Nice People, nice place. Just wish the weather had been better and it had been closer to more activities. Or I had won more than$12.50 at the slots :-)

Reviews.Title: “Do you expect to find a Vegas-like hotel in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: ManuGraillansky
Reviews.Content: When you arrived in San Juan book the fisrt night in this kind of place is pretty confortable.
