You know where you will stay as this hotel is just a copy of what you can find in the US Sheratons. Casino's, Large Room, Freezing with AC... Good job for the Sheraton team as service is the same as in other part of the US but while travelling to Caraibean places you can expect places more exotics!

Reviews.Title: “All in All - A Pretttay Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Infrequent T
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 4 Day / 3 Night stay at the Sheraton. Here are my brief observations: The rooms are very nice with great views of San Juan Bay and the cruise ships that frequently come to port. Bathroom is a bit small but definitely manageable. Beds are very comfortable. Food is good but is VERY expensive. Casino is small. Their pool area is very nice. They have a large outdoor "Jacuzzi" and a very large swimming pool. Lots of room to sunbathe and many lounge and beach chairs all around. Nice Fitness Center. Location is a bit "remote". There are always cabs ready to take you wherever you'd like but the minimum you'll pay is $12-$15 before tip.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you're attending a convention @ the convention center accross the street”
Reviews.Author: bluelace
Reviews.Content: Just another business hotel nothing special to me. The location is convenient if you're attending a convention, if you're touring San Juan you will need a car.The hotel has 2 restaurants and a casino. I stayed @ the executive floor with access to the club lounge I enjoyed the terrace and the view from the lounge and the service as well, the appetizers and breakfast were poor. The lounge charges for wine and beer that's quite unusual but is Puerto Rico...

Reviews.Title: “New, but not in walking distance to much”
Reviews.Author: smvhou
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers that this property does not measure up to Starwood's ongoing quality hype, even though it is new. Part of the new Convention Center complex, which already seems to be experiencing some economic hiccups, that has interrupted complex completion. A multi-story unfinished steel building skeleton sits in front of the hotel, & the retail complex that sits on the 1st floor of the adjoining parking garage appears to be totally vacant. It is several dark vacant blocks to anywhere even remotely close to the hotel, which I would not wander through at night. The hotel itself is the typical big convention center design, with a very unimpressive casino adjoining the lobby. The rooms are still new & welcoming, but I am shocked that a totally new hotel, built from the ground up, would contain bathrooms so small that they had to install sliding doors, because regular doors could not be used.They planned a new hotel this way? If 2 people try to use the room, 1 will have to step into the bathtub. The rooms are furnished very nicely, & the hotel isn't bad, but it does not meet the quality levels of similar Sheraton Hotels. And, unfortunately, service levels, or the lack thereof, are all over the place. All of the staff we encountered were polite, courteous & wanted to help, so I can't fault them. It just seems that factual training is non-existent at the property. Not a single employee we asked a question of, had an answer or seemed to be knowledgeable. To say service was horrible in both the lobby bar & restaurant would be to give a compliment. Left the lobby bar after sitting for 15+ minutes & never seeing a single employee enter the area --- at 4:30PM on a Saturday. Was seated by the hostess in the lobby restaurant & abandoned. No one ever appeared to take our order, even though there were, maybe, only 3 other tables occupied at 12:00 noon on a Sunday. And probably the most pitiful Sunday Brunch Buffet I have ever seen at a hotel of this claimed-quality. Finally returned to the hostess stand & asked if anyone was going to wait on us? She apologized & disappeared never to be seen again, so I went to the kitchen door & asked 1 of the 2 waiters standing there if 1 of them could wait on us. Polite, courteous & apologetic, just seemingly clueless & untrained. Management (???) seems to be totally non-existent in this facility. The surrounding grounds are lovely & inviting. Very small pool area for a hotel this large, but still pleasant. From a location standpoint, you need a taxi to go anywhere. Better Sheraton choice is the property in Old San Juan, or any of the hotels along the Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy room carpet, big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Review2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not seem to be that old, but the carpet in my room was filthy and stained. I got my white socks really dirty by just walking around the room. I only stayed here one night or would have requested a different room. The rest of the hotel looked nice and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business trips”
Reviews.Author: mencos1
Reviews.Content: I was just here for a conference, stayed 4 nights. The hotel is pretty new and very well maintained, the rooms are in great shape. Staff was a bit overwhelmed by the 100% occupancy which made some services like getting extra towels very slow, but very happy with the experience. The Convention Center is right in front of the hotel and Old San Juan about 10 minutes by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel outside of Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: AMcRush
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 6 nights in the hotel. The amenities included free Strabucks coffee in the room and bottled water. The rooms are smal yet comfortable. The beds were very comfortable. There is a media lounge, casino, and pool deck in the hotel. We spent most of our time on the pool deck in the hot tub. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Cesar introduced us to our favorite resturant Bebo's in Condado. There are no resturants, shops, markets or other attractions nearby. You either have to take the bus (runs every 32 minutes) or rent a car and drive into Old San Juan or other nearby towns

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but the service....”
Reviews.Author: Resende99
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel & Casino is confortable, well designed and with a classical decoration. Everything would be perfect if it was not some lack of attention to the details specially related to service. I spent two nights at the hotel to participate at an international conference, the reception very kind but slow. The safe in the room was not working and in spite of the requests nobody came to fix it. The hotel charged $5 to hand a package which was send to me from Miami. The staff at the restaurant has a tendency to forget what you have ordered. Would I come back? For a conference: yes; For a holiday with my wife, I donÂ´t think so.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent-PreCruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: Acd32
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but I felt that I need to let everyone know how great this hotel is, specially the staff. My family and I vacationed at this hotel for 3 days before our cruise, we choose the hotel because it was close to the Royal Caribbean port and it seemed to be a nice new hotel, and yes it was! From the moment the taxi driver drove into the hotel you can fell the fresh new look of this place! It is absolutely beautiful! Their lobby is open and colorful, very chic and modern! But the highlight of our stay comes down to the front desk, when we arrive there were two guys at the desk, Cesar and Josuet we named them the guys whit a 1,000 smiles! These two guys made our stay; I have been in many hotels around the world but had never felt so welcome in my life. Every time we saw them a genuine smile appeared on their face. They have a sparkle of happiness that makes them stand out. The hotel staff makes you feel at home, the rooms are nice and big; their pool is large and has an infinity edge overlooking the bay of San Juan. The food is good! Breakfast itâ€™s always hot and lots of selections. The do give the extra mile on taking care of your needs as Josuet even help us coordinate tours and dinner reservations for our cruise!!! One night we ate at Texas de Brazil but my 8yr. old didnâ€™t liked anything from the options and said no to every attempt the waiter made to convince her! After that we meet josuet at the desk for a moment and commented to him my daughter was not very into the food in the Steakhouse and he actually stepped out of the desk and talked to her, by asking if she would like to have a Super VIP pizza deliver to the room. She agreed and waited anxiously at the room for her pizza! The pizza did not only arrive but josuet actually delivered it himself whit a piece of paper that she still has that reads â€œVIP Pizza Princessâ€�. All this little details truly remarks how great the staff and service at this hotel is! My family and I left the day of our cruise but these 3 days were by far the best short pre-vacation ever! We are definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “A Shakira Concert at San Juan”
Reviews.Author: pittman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned from a weekend at this hotel. The only reason for our trip was to attend the Shakira concert so I did not care much for a beachfront hotel or an island vacation. I just booked on hotwire and got a good deal. The hotel was ok; nothing great; but adequate and basically met our needs. From a beach vacation point this hotel would be a miss with nothing in walking distance. (We do like to walk) It is good for the conventioneers or someone on a cruise. (Pre or post stay) The staff in general was efficient, no complaints there except the house keeping had not reached our room even by late afternoon. Surprisingly I could not find the yellow pages in the room. Maybe it has become outdated in the era of digital fingertips. Ate at the Brazilian Churrascaria both nights and as expected it was wonderful. There is a small casino that is sufficient to wet your appetite, When I come back to PR ,, I would go back to Conrad ,which is more to my liking. Again it is not a vote against this hotel but it is what it is ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Really good experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Marie1217
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location. I stayed with my husband, and we loved the experience. Rooms were beautiful, clean and had a breathtaking view. The staff was really nice, specially Mr. Cesar Cintron who made of our stay one to be remembered. Totally recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Parking Manager”
Reviews.Author: jgarcia0565
Reviews.Content: During my recent stay at this property there was the worst experience with a parking facilities. I asked to meet a parking manager and I got the worst response from him by phone. He should be replaced for an experienced, bilingual and customer well oriented manager.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: SportsFreak30
Reviews.Content: From the front desk, to the restaurant, to the lobby bar, to the pool bar, to the gift shop clerk.....the customer service was my worst experience in any Starwood property, ever!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing escapes away from the rat race....”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Leasure_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel with great service! There is currently construction on both sides, try and get a room overlooking the pool & bay... The Texas, Brazilian steak house is amazing, but go hungry! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, not the Sheraton experience that I am used to”
Reviews.Author: LrdIthku
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice/Customer Service in need of improvement,

Reviews.Title: “Summer in December”
Reviews.Author: girlonthegogo
Reviews.Content: This hotel overall was very nice and upscale. We had a double queen bed room. It was very modern and clean. Nice size bathroom. The service staff were helpful as we tried to find things to do and get around. The only thing con is the location. While it sit off the harbor it's not within walking distance of a beach or any other attractions. We took taxi's everywhere. The good thing about the taxi's were you paid for the trip and not per person so you can split the costs. We had breakfast every morning at the hotel and the food was always fresh and hot (buffet.) The hotel gave us discounted vouchers for our breakfast. The pool is rooftop and over looks the downtown area. Very serene yet sexy. For visitors if you must stay here I'd suggest visiting Old San Juan to eat and do some shopping. We went to their largest mall, visted the beach and toured the Bacardi Factory that was fun and free. They even give you 2 complimentary drinks.

Reviews.Title: “A night before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Hazel T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our Carnival Victory cruise to the South Caribbean.The king room we took was spacious and gave us a very good/relaxing night sleep. It is located close to San Juan which is a convenient distance for a day of sight seeing (e.g., El Morro and Castillo De San Cristobal). The bus stop is a block away but is infrequent on a weekend. Because we're on a tight sched to see as much as we want of San Juan before our cruise, we had to take the taxi which is a considerable amount knowing it's $12-15/way vs. bus $0.75. In the morning, we discovered, the hotel had a very inviting infinity pool, facing the port. With the ships on the dock it was an awesome sight...I wish we had more time to take a dip (this, I think, is a must do in this hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel or Convention, not best choice for vacation.”
Reviews.Author: BeachFairy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice property overall. I think it was great for my business trip. For example, you'll find it great IF you have a car - then the locations becomes easy to get in-and-out off, close to everything, with many dinner choices and even a nice beach for an afternoon escapade, all within a 5 minute drive. You will need a car though, there is not much within walking distance, except the Convention Center. If your not going to an event there, there is nothing you will reach by foot. The food was good but really pricey. Maybe it's because the portions are huge. I think they should consider smaller portions and a % price reduction. It would make better sense. I am very thankful to the valet staff, whom helped me navigate San Juan much better than my rental-car GPS unit did. I would never choose it for a vacation trip though. It's blocked to the water by many freeways, the pool feels so public and displayed, its got no "local" feel at all. Any Old San or beach front location would easily beat this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: satchel21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for one night. We were going on a cruise the next day and wanted to spend some time in San Juan. The hotel is very nice. The lobby is very inviting and has a wall sculpture that changes color. The elevators are conveniently located near the desk. You have to swipe your room key in the elevator in order for it to operate. I was happy to have that added security feature. The room was spacious and clean but had an odd smell. It was not overwhelming but was constant. It smelled like mildew but I did not find any in the room. The room had the same amenities of other Sheraton properties. I ordered room service for a late night snack. The food was hot and delicious. It was delivered promptly. The hotel has an incredible infinity pool. We swam at night and had a very nice view. The water was warm and clean. There is also a large hot tub which was wonderful to soak in. We enjoyed talking with other guests. There is a casino located in the hotel. We played a little and broke even. If you gamble they will bring you complementary cocktails and sandwiches. The next morning we sat at the bar before checking in for the cruise. The bartender was wonderful. He went out of his way to find a football game for us to watch. They use satellite TV and finding a channel that carries a NFL game is not easily achieved. Overall we enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff was very friendly and the property was beautiful. If we take another cruise out of San Juan we will most certainly stay at the property again.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a resort hotel regardless of the name and price”
Reviews.Author: Duel1013
Reviews.Content: This is not a resort hotel. This is an overpriced convention hotel. I have stand in 4 and 5-star hotels from Bangkok to Boston and place in between. In my opinion, this place just does not meet the standard. Although nice enough, it was very overpriced for the services provided. Very inconvenient to any place else in the city and was far from what I would define as a resort except for the prices. I would recommend staying at the Old San Juan Sheraton if you really want to stay at a Sheraton. Other than that, go some where else that will be the same or less expensive and be a resort hotel. The convenience to the Convention Center is not worth the price of this place. I felt conned when I left.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service especially the front desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: tinamurillo
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Close to everything when planning to stroll down Old San Juan! I recently stayed this weekend with my friend and we enjoyed every single stay @ this hotel. The manager of front desk name Jouset gave us an amazing customer service. All the staff was super friendly and helpful when asking about places where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrmarutiak
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is relatively new so the rooms are modern, spacious, and clean. The facilities such as the pool, bar, weight rooms are wonderful. The location is a bit to be desired since there are very few establishments near the hotel. Check in is slow. Usually only one person working the desks...so when a crowd appears you can be waiting for a long time! Casino has very few tables and no craps...so if you gamble beware.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID!!!!”
Reviews.Author: macmaven
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the audacity to charge for services NOT rendered (watch for mysterious bellman and room attendant "tips"), gave promises to remove said charges, and then went ahead and processed them anyway. Not to be trusted, so vote with your wallet and avoid this place if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “OK for Pre Cruise”
Reviews.Author: jsrmck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, pre- and post-cruise, in June. The rooms are spacious and well maintained. Front desk was somewhat disorganized. We arrived quite early and the room was not ready. They took our cell phone number number and sent us to the (very nice) pool to wait. Several hours later, I returned to the desk to ask about the room. The front desk receptionist said they had tried to call us, but there was no record of a call on my cell phone. Food in the hotel's restaurants was very expensive, and the area was somewhat isolated. We took taxis to downtown one night and the Condado area another night for dinner. Unless you are attending a conference here at the convention center, there are other, more centrally located hotels in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “It's Ok...”
Reviews.Author: Wislie
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice and clean. Upon check in, the welcome was not very â€œwelcomingâ€�, it felt as if it was an obligation to say "Welcome." Check in was fast, Front desk Agent pointed out where the elevators were and told us our room number. When we got to the elevator, if it not been for another guest who explains how the elevator works, we where never going to guess how to get to our floor. Any way, the hotel is very nice but regarding service they can improve more.

Reviews.Title: “We had an awesome time”
Reviews.Author: doart
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an amazing weekend at the Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel & Casino. We stay there for one night on labor day weekend to celebrate my husbands birthday. The suite was awesome, the views were incredible and everything was just lovely. We would definitely like to come back again and for sure recommended to all our friends. The staff was nice and friendly, always willing to help with a smile. The food at the restaurants and the drinks were very good. We also enjoyed the relaxing spa and we had fun at the casino. Everything in the hotel is so nice, elegant, and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for one night”
Reviews.Author: jeffbatl
Reviews.Content: my wife and i decided to stay here for one night before we stayed at our beach front resort for our vacation. we really thought this hotel was outstanding. they gave us a room upgrade because we told them it was our anniversary and also gave us some drink coupons. the rooms were very nice and spacious. good amenities and clean. although the location wasn't the greatest (close to the convention center but not the beach) we really liked this place and would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you can stand the sound of unrelenting latino music”
Reviews.Author: luxuryliver
Reviews.Content: For a five star hotel, this one falls well short of the mark. Check-in took 40 minutes while enquiries of Sheraton gold and platinum club members were prioritized. The room was comfortable but there were signs of neglect, e.g. soiled carpets and a coffee machine that didn't work. The environmental deal of meal vouchers in return for servicing your own room was not worth it. The staff were courteous and for the most part helpful but the laid back approach to life in Puerto Rico was forever evident - food trays left for hours in the corridors; food remnants on carpets in public areas left uncleared for more than 24 hours; unrelenting latino music in all public areas, slow service in the dining room, etc. The location is ideal for those attending conventions across the road or even for those using the excellent conference facilities provided at the hotel itself, but it is otherwise out of the way for the average tourist. We enjoyed the evenings spent in the lobby bar and the food available there was sufficient to make an evening meal but overall, by European standards, we would view the hotel experience as being 4star minus at best.

Reviews.Title: “WEEKEND DISASTER”
Reviews.Author: gary r
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I were staying at El Conquistador for 2weeks we decided to go to the Sheraton San Juan at The convention Center for A weekend getaway to get pampered. The hotel is beautiful the lobby presentation was amazing unfortionatley, the SPA MASSAGE was very dissatisfying. it felt like they just rubbed oil all over our bodies. the blankets were cold. the music was not relaxing. the hotel should remove the spa or get people who are better skilled!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MorleyLeedsCaz
Reviews.Content: We were allocated this hotel for one night prior to a weeks cruise from san juan. It is a very very nice hotel, infact I would say it is rather posh. We were B & B and the breakfast was fantastice and the staff coudn't do enough for us. The pool is wow with a fantastic view of the cruise ships that are docked. The only thing I would say about this hotel is that it is a bit of a way out if you are staying for a week and it doesn't have a beach but we couldn't fault it one bit. The convention centre is opposite and when there is something on there, there is a lovely little bar that serves drinks and food at a reasonable price . You can sit and enjoy the music and the lovely fountains that are there. The locals use this too, but all are very friendly, but when there is nothing on at the convention centre with the bar being closed it is very very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a one night stay before our cruise”
Reviews.Author: alison303
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and clean and more the satisfactory for our one night stay prior to the cruise. It is a short (and cheap) taxi ride to the cruise terminal from here and you can actually see the ships from the rooms. The location isn't ideal if you'd like to spent your time in Old San Juan but it isn't an expensive taxi ride if the hotel costs in Old San Juan are too expensive. The rooms were spacious and clean and the pool area looked nice. I can't speak to the added charges other guests were experiencing, but we booked this hotel through Hotwire and had no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Costs, Dodgy Accounting”
Reviews.Author: A D
Reviews.Content: First, check you bill very carefully...they tried to charge me 30 dollars for each local call I made and then charged an extra 15 dollars per day service charge, on top of the 15 dollars in taxes, which they did not mention when I booked the reservation. Second, there is really nothing around this hotel to see...no beaches or shops. Just the convention center. It would be better to stay at the Conrad or Caribe Hilton, or in Old San Juan itself.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Possibly My Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: MolecularTraveler
Reviews.Content: I simply do not know where to begin to describe my horrendous my stay at this "hotel": the filthy room, the terrible service, or the mysterious appearance of an extra $40.00 ($10.00 for the bellman and $30.00 for "room upgrade") per day on my hotel bill. The room had numerous stains on the carpet and the shower curtain had dubious brown splatter stains. Upon receiving the final bill, I questioned the excessive charges. After an hour on the phone with the manager, they confessed that this was a "mistake" and removed these charges. For my stay, this amounted to $340.00 "extra charges". They promised to email me the newly adjusted bill. However, I insisted that they also give me a hard copy of this adjusted bill--more than a week has passed and I have yet to receive the bill via email. Attending a chemistry conference at the conference center, I had a number of colleagues staying at this hotel--they all had similar problems with this hotel. This is a terrible hotel and I cannot recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Olivia110061
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, safe and modern with comfortable beds. It is about a 10 minute drive from Old San Juan. There was a lot of construction going on around the hotel. I believe they are developing that area. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I especially liked the idea that you are not able to get to a particular floor without having to swipe your room key in the lobby elevator first. I would stay there again if I ever have the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt think it was a gamble coming here but it was and we lost!”
Reviews.Author: Coffeeprincess
Reviews.Content: Overall stay here was very disappointing. Excellent looking location adjacent to the magnificent wave-shaped convention centre. Though situated only about 15 mins away from Old San Juan in one direction and the beach area of Condado in another, the roads/motorways in between make safe walking a no-no. Taxi rides are therefore a necessity and add considerably to the cost of your stay. Good points. Our room was spacious, having a view of the 4th floor pool area, and the bathroom/shower facility was okay. Bad points. Housekeeping was erratic, with rooms cleaned early in the morning or late into the evening. Fresh linen was rare. We had a tead in our sheet which was never replaced. We had to exchange our keycard on a regular basis as they frequently stopped working and we had to queue for ages to get the new ones. Service was generally slow and casual. There is only one hotel restaurant, "choices", the name of `which was contradictory to what it actually offered. The menu does not appear to change much and the food is average at best. It was rarely busy in the evenings. Amazingly for a conference facility there is no coffee shop. If we ever visit San Juan again, even to attend the convention centre, we will be bypassing this casino-attached hotel and look for something better for our money in Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Most irregular room service ever...”
Reviews.Author: Medea89
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for people in Puerto Rico on business trips, especially given its proximity to the Convention Center. It is quiet (which was surprising given the casino on the first floor) and has many amenities within the hotel itself. There is, however, not much to do, see, or eat in the immediate vicinity. There were a couple of huge problems with this hotel though: they did not have our rooms ready when we arrived (check-in is at 3:00 pm, and we arrived after 7:30 pm), which is inexcusable. The room service (for which there is a daily fee) was stunningly erratic- there was a day where I received no towels, and the combination of shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel, etc. varied from day to day. We also did not receive the two bottles of water (or newspaper) that we were supposed to receive every day- sometimes we got one, sometimes two, sometimes none (upon checking in, we were informed that we were paying an extra fee that included two water bottles (and a newspaper)daily). Also, the happy hour at the pool, which has good prices on beer and mojitos, was very inconsistent. The first bartender we had made very good mojitos, but the second bartender made mojitos that tasted like watery lemonade (I think his name was Benny); I decided to order a beer instead, and it took this bartender at least 15 minutes to pour a beer and give me the receipt. None of these problems in isolation would have been a huge deal, but having to deal with all of them was unacceptable. Just very inconsistent overall.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, not the best location now”
Reviews.Author: tsfl61
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel. Huge lobby, nice decor. There was no one else in line at check-iin so it went very smooth. No problems with the room other than a few hairs in the bathroom. Casino was busy and fun. There was live music the night I was there. No complaints about my stay. If I'd been there longer I would have been bored. There is nothing within walking distance except the convention facility. If you were staying longer and wanted to see the sights, you would need to rent a car, take a taxi, or ride the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 42Eyes
Reviews.Content: Quick service. They checked us in early otherwise we'd be on the stormy streets with Emily nearby. Beautiful hotel. Few restaurants. Choices- offered a "free" continental we went with the buffet instead. Good food. But, lunch time the service was very slow! It was like the waiter was avoiding us. But, great Churrasco , strawberry & avacado salad. Rooms were just as nice & clean. Loved the earthy look and furniture. Obviously used an interior designer with the entire hotel. Got a crib with-in the hour they checked back with me 2x's to make sure I got it. Wished we had more time to use the roof top infinity pool. Would definately go back. GReat bath products as well. My children loved it..

Reviews.Title: “So-So Hotel, Worst Staff”
Reviews.Author: JasStorrs_CT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel and Casino mostly for the meeting at the Convention Center. The problem started with a 4 hour delay for check-in. The staff refused to tell me when the room would be ready so I spent 4 hours in the lobby with 50 people waiting in the lobby for check-in. The maid service was very bad. The carpet in the room had huge blotches of black mold. The food was very pricey and included a 25 percent gratuity and then we were prompted to tip additionally on the bill. In addition, there was a $15 surcharge per day for the room for services that were not rendered so I insisted they remove the surcharge which they eventually did after an argument. Buyer beware. Very shady hotel. The view from the hotel is okay but the hotel is in a terrible location and not near any restaurants or shops. Only stay here if you really have to go to the convention center frequently. Otherwise stay elsewhere. There is a wonderful Indian restaurant named Tantra in Old San Juan which is 15 minutes by taxi. Fabulous South Indian Food and martinis. Expensive but highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Treat!!”
Reviews.Author: HillaryPfeiffer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few days before our cruise on the Carnival Victory! The hotel itself is lovely and our room was just a nice. We were a short cab ride from the Old Town San Juan Area which wasnt so bad. And another short cab ride the day of the cruise departure to the port. 12.00 each way I got a great deal on Hotwire.com for this hotel and for 89.00 a night, I think I did well. We enjouyed the rooftop pool, it overlooked the ports and you could get a really unique view of the cruise ships. We enjoyed sitting outside at the pool grill and bar to enjoy cocktails and a bite to eat. The casino itself was small but hey it was a casino and gave us a few hours of fun. Won 60.00, only spent 10.00! There is not much to do around the hotel itself except for the convention center which was ok with us, we were about to board a very busy 7 day cruise with 1000's of others so chillin by the pool and relaxing was perfect a few days before. We did rent a car and do a day trip to the rain forest national park about 45 minutes away, perfect day trip! (we considered San Juan our first port of call and that was our first excursion!) But the hotel itself was very nice, if not brand new almost and the food in all restaurants was on the higher side but very tasty, pool bar & grill was better value during happy hour!

Reviews.Title: “Pool was the highlight, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: taqueeney
Reviews.Content: We chose this Hotel for its proximity to the conference centre. And for location purposes it is good, 100 meter walk to the conference. There is also a reasonable restaurant between the hotel and the centre. We checked in reasonably fast, 2 of our friends were waiting in line the day before we arrived for 90 minutes however. Staff at this Hotel demonstrated that they were there only for the pay check. We got a strong impression that know one was interested in helping you. For example, we were using breakfast coupons for 'American' breakfasts. After being seated and seeing the buffet we expected this was the 'American' breakfast, to only be lectured 10 minutes later that we were to be charged for the buffet as we should have ordered off the menu. This led to a lengthy debate on communication techniques of restaurant staff. The next day we were told the opposite. FYI the breakfast is not that good, scrambled eggs can bounce in this restaurant and maybe the best choice is the yoghurt as it is not made OFF site. Unfortunately this area once had big plans judging by the shafts of steel construction rusting away in the neighbouring property. This means Sheraton food is very expensive! There is a brazilian steakhouse, do not expect value here either for a $60 steak and buffet. Your saviour is the bus system that run s passed the hotel into town, have coins available to feed the onboard ticket machine, very cheap and takes approx 18 minutes into San Juan. Our room was adequate, for the price it was it was rather inadequate I feel. See my Andalucia review for the guest house we stayed at in San Juan. We often had to ask for clean water glasses following our room being serviced, however complimentary water was always available for outings. The local town is a walking distance where you can find a pharmacy, some fast food, and supermarket...potentially too far to walk back with purchases. Before you look at the Old Sheraton reviews we had a friend who also stayed there. Room was bigger and location is where all the action happens in San Juan. Still expensive, no breakfast (no loss), small pool. Sheraton Casino has an amazing pool and huge sun deck which was the highlight of this hotel. We spent many hours up here in our spare time that was always well kept by the pool boy with towels etc. You may like to consider taking your own drinks, there is a bar open during the day however Sheraton prices exist be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice look but won't be going back to this one!”
Reviews.Author: NYNurse10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked with this hotel for 6 nights. It is beautiful inside and out but not close to anything but the convention center(so if you are attending an event at the conv. center then it is perfect) Condado and Old San Juan are at least a $13 taxi ride one way. We wound up taking the bus often because of the price difference from the taxis which are outrageously expensive and not for everyday spending! So from the bus we got to see a lot of the projects in the local area...nice! No refrigerator in the room which was a pain so we couldn't really keep any leftovers. The one restaurant in the hotel - Texas de Brazil was delicious and great service but not for eating at every night because it is expensive and you eat so much!! So the other food choices in the hotel are not good and very few. And there is no where in walking distance to get a bite to eat. The infinity pool is beautiful but got crowded often and closed early evening around 7pm. Also at the end of the stay, we got a letter under our door telling us that checkout would be at 11am not their usual 12pm...nice again! And also a bill for $55 for local phone calls which I found out were to Florida - we live in New York and don't call Florida ever so that means someone used our phone! So the concierge was helpful and told us that they were going to disregard the charges because I was upset. So anyway - the concierges were extremely helpful and pleasant and well as most of the other staff - just the location is a big downer - we would definitely stay out on the west or southern coast next time or in Old San Juan since that is where we spent most of our time. Also there was a stain on our carpet and the pillows were not good!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, filthy carpets & weekend party nights for the locals”
Reviews.Author: peasey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before and after a cruise. On our first night there we arrived after 4 only to find our room not ready, so we were upgraded to a suite. A suite with no linens for the pullout sofa and carpets stained worse than any LaQuinta I've ever stayed at - huge dark brown stains on beige carpeting in every room. Despite numerous calls to the front desk, the linens for the pullout didn't arrive until 9:30pm. We were able to make those numerous calls because we checked in on a Saturday and the hotel was throwing a party for the locals, as they apparently do every weekend. A Coors Light Party. The lobby, elevators and halls were full of drunk girls in overstuffed bikinis, guys who reeked of beer, sweat and marijuana, and general mayhem. Because the party was being held at the pool, we were told our children were not permitted to swim; and so we were confined to our dirty little room. There is very little around the hotel, so we ordered room service for the kids. It took two hours for it to arrive: overpriced, undercooked, cold pizza, the front desk explained it away by saying that they were having trouble finding someone to bring it to the room since all of their employees were waiting on the local drunks at the pool. The next morning we went down to the pool only to find it full of cigarette butts and smelling of urine. The maintenance crew arrived minutes after us, ushered everyone out and taped it off until they could clean it. They wouldn't let us change our returning reservation to the Old San Juan Sheraton without paying some sort of fee, so we went back for two nights following the cruise. Same filthy carpets, same poor service... Don't bother with the optional add on of the 12th floor lounge's continental breakfast and nightly Hors d'Å“uvres - they were usually served an hour late and the food ran out within minutes. The lounge attendants were also bizarrely protective of their offerings, at one point trying to convince two of our children to split one hot cocoa packet between both of their cups of water. The restaurant downstairs is fairly pricey: $15 for a hamburger, $20 for the breakfast buffet. Also check your bill. They were adding an unexplainable $30 "Service Fee" to every night's stay. When they failed to provide a reasonable explanation for its existence, we had it removed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and accomodations, but the worst customer service ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Goodnis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit of a catch 22. While it was beautiful and definitely pulled out all the stops for luxury, the lack of customer service will ensure that I never stay there again. Due to a mistake of the hotel billing a company for my hotel bill that I was not affiliated with, I have spent over 8 hours on the phone trying to get this resolved (still unresolved three weeks later). Not once was I ever called back (I always had to call them). I was lucky if my emails were answered within 10 days. I was staying at the hotel for a conference along with many other colleagues, all of whom had some sort of problem with their hotel bills who are experiencing difficulty in getting resolution.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: lucky49
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend after spending a week in Condando at a friendâ€™s apartment because of a party in the hotel on Saturday night. The location is central in that you can get to the Condando downtown area (over the bridge) in 2 minutes and to Old San Juan in 5-7 minutes as well. We took the bus (quick and cheap) but there were plenty of taxis as the hotel is right across from the new convention center. The rooms were nice, however, the view from one side of the building is great...pool...cruise ships...and the other gives you a view of Condando (not so nice...the view, not the town). So I would request a pool side room if you want a nice view. The pool area is nice...not huge, but big enough to take a dip and cool down. There is a bar/snack area which is very reasonable. The area was crowded, but there were places to sit and lounge, just not in the shade if you needed it...you had to get down early for that. Also, there was a fountain area that kids can play in (my 1 year old LOVED it). To be clear, you can't 'swim' here but it is deep enough to get your whole body wet and there are ledges for kids as well. The best part of the hotel is the service. The people working there were great...very helpful and courteous. Didnâ€™t care for the breakfast buffet (pricey for what you get, but what do you expect), however the staff was quick with drinks and coffee. Not sure I would stay again, but not because of the hotel, just because it is not our style. However, if you want a modern, clean hotel this place was great....and if you stay on the 12th floor, you get access to a lounge area that has breakfast and a great balcony with a nice view (this was there the party was on Saturday night). All in all a very nice stay and I could recommend this to anyone who likes this style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service”
Reviews.Author: MarMurAgu
Reviews.Content: The room that we reserved was bay view with balcony and ended up in a room with view to the garden with balcony, filled with mosquitos. Called guest services and after a long wait somebody answered and told us that the room supervisor would come to our room. Never came. We looked for a chambermaid in the hallway and come to see and confirmed that the room was infested with mosquitos. She called somebody who said that the supervisor would come. Never came. We tried to call back to the front desk and nobody answered. We had to go down to the front desk and demanded to speak to a manager, who said that he would take care of it. He did an finally we where taken to another room. View to the bay no balcony. The following day we wanted to order room service and there was no menu in the room. We called room service and they said that a menu would be sent to our room. After a long wait a chambermaid came and asked if we needed to have our room cleaned and we said that what we needed was a room service menu, she answered that in this hotel room service means cleaning the rooms. Wow. Very bad and poor service and worse guest services.

Reviews.Title: “We would be back”
Reviews.Author: milsi123
Reviews.Content: The trip was great, the hotel was very clean, no musty smell at all. The food at the pool area was great a bit expensive but not to bad. Dont order from room to many taxes. Go an order from bar area next to casino and take it up to your room. The cabs are a rip off. Try to negotiate before getting in the cab. If not rent a car. Watch out for Do not park signs. They are very small, we saw about 20 people get tickets at the forest and around hotel, both had one small sign. The PR people need to be more friendly they forgot customer service. Besides that wonderful and beautiful place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but not near beach”
Reviews.Author: JennDC28
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in puerto rico for business. The rooms were fantastic and the hotel is lovely. Its right next to the convention center but it is not near the beach you would have to take a cab. The hotel and spa are awesome too though!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Large Hotel, Casino is soso”
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, you must take a taxi anywhere else. Housekeeping staff was tops! Front desk slow at times, seemed to have very large groups checking in and out which subtracted from the individual traveller. Had dinner at Choices one night, the waiter was most helpful, (better than the concierge)! Nice rooms, noisy at times, slow service at times, but overall 3.5

Reviews.Title: “This hotel feels like home and the employees are family here!”
Reviews.Author: amayains
Reviews.Content: I travel here at least once a month for a few weeks. The hotel staff is very friendly and all know me by name. It's become a place that feels like home, not just because I am here so often but because I feel COMFORTABLE here. The bartenders are wonderful, the breakfast staff is always so friendly, happy and inviting and the food is excellent. I especially want to give a HUGE thumbs up and thank you to a particular housekeeping attendant, Marysa Larios (last name? on the 9th floor). Because I normally take advantage of the $5 GO GREEN voucher when I skip housekeeping, I normally leave a note asking for the attendant to leave some extra coffee, towels and bottled water for the days that I skip. Because I am here for 2-3 weeks every month, I have done this very often. I have always been pleased the attendant each stay has always met my expectations and been very kind leaving the things I requested. They always right a pleasant note back to me saying they honored my request. BUT THIS TIME, Marysa went above and beyond and left me a plenty of coffee and cups and lids and creamers, etc as well as extra towels, bottled water AND left me an extra tray of body soap, shampoo & conditioner, mouthwash, body wash and even loofahs! These are all the things that I normally would need and would have to call every couple days and ask guest services to have some sent up to my room. I walked in my room and was just amazed at the level of cleanliness and graciousness and understanding of all the things I need for such a long stay. I wish she would be assigned to my room every time!!! I will also be leaving a comment card at the hotel for her. Make sure when you stay here, you request the 9th floor! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Built for conferences”
Reviews.Author: singularity0
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with built-in conference center, located near a small airport. If you are attending a conference there it's fine, but avoid to stay here if you want to see San Juan. The rooms are good but show some signs of age, I've seen better Sheraton rooms elsewhere. Beds are big and comfortable. Internet is not free. Room service is very slow (took them more than one hour to deliver a burger, which was cold). Also wait times in the restaurant can be long, especially during the breakfast rush. Avoid the "continental breakfast" as it consists of incredibly sweet pastries instead of bread or toast. The checkout queue was massive, so I was glad for the "phone checkout" option. The pool and spa area is nice, although the view could be better. The casino is dead empty at most times. The gym is clean and has all the latest equipment. There's no shops in the area, so for eating out or shopping you need to get a taxi. You can walk to a nearby beach, but it involves crossing some busy roads which seemed a bit risky to me. All in all, you get what you can expect for that price, but I'm sure there are better options in SJ.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but further away from downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Kothari-NY
Reviews.Content: A great place to relax and chill out. Rooms are great but the pool gets crowded and dirty. However downtown is about 15-20 mts away. Downtown here means Old San Juan, the place where everything is happening from great food to great bar's. Carlo Ponce and Dominique were extremely good and they made sure our trip was as comforting as could be.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: agentmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel before leaving for our Caribbean cruise. We arrived in San Juan early afternoon one day before embarking on our cruise. Our room was not ready yet, but it was before check in time. They took our cell phone number and said they would call us when ready. We took a taxi for a $15 to Old San Juan, which was about a 10 minute drive or so. We found a restaurant for lunch pretty quickly and while we were eating had a call that the room was ready. Since we didn't want to have go back and forth by Taxi too often, due to the cost we decided to explore Old San Juan for a while before going back. When we were done later in the afternoon, we took a taxi back for another $15 or so. We collected our luggage which the hotel had stored for us and proceeded to the room. We were on one of the higher floor and it took a few seconds to figure out that you had to swipe your room key in the elevator for it to work. The room was a nice size with a king size bed that was very comfortable. The furnishes and decor were nice while not being anything fancy. There was a coffee maker and ironing board we appreciated. The bathroom was stocked well with soaps,shampoo, conditioner and lotions, which is more than what was on the cruise. The shower was very nice. For dinner we decided to walk to a Sizzler restaurant that we had notice while passing by in the taxi earlier. I was surprise to find out that we didn't see others walking there. The restaurant was ok and was reasonable. It was a busy place with mostly locals. The only other place to eat that we saw was the restaurant at the hotel. After dinner we walked back to the hotel to try out the pool. The water was very cold, so we went in the hot tub instead. There was a bar next to the pool, which was located on one of the upper floors with a nice view of the convention center and the fountain below. That night there was an outdoor fashion show at the center, which we could see from the pool. Check out was smooth the next morning as all we had to do was turn in our key. We had breakfast at the buffet in the hotel, which was a little expensive but very good. The hotel store our luggage so we could go and tour the Bacardi Factory. The hotel had tour which included the Factory, but it was cheaper to go there by taxi. The taxis are always easy to get right outside the hotel. After the tour we called back the same drive to pick us up. We collected our luggage pretty quickly and got another taxi to take us the port. Each taxi ride cost us about $15- $25. It was a nice hotel, but I would probably stay right in Old San Juan next time, where there would be more places to walk around. For a place to stay near the convention center, to use the casino, or just to sleep before a cruise it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: FordTraveller
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, connected to the conference center. Nice pool, no beach. Traveled over the Good Friday/Easter long weekend. Note that the casino closes during religious holidays (closed the Fri and Sun) -- more the country than the hotel. Had I known that, I would have gone to another country for this weekend getaway! But the hotel is nice - great for business and conference, but if you want a hotel by the beach, this is NOT it.... Nice clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a night”
Reviews.Author: BobMyr
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night prior to our AM flight out of San Juan. The hotel served that purpose. Other than that, it is not located within walking distance of any major sites, the check-in took a long time, and the food prices were outrageous. It would be cheaper and better to take a cab to Old San Juan and eat at a restaurant like Cafe El Punto. However, I was happy to have booked this hotel through Hotwire at a substantial discount.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value but not much in the area yet”
Reviews.Author: Britinva79
Reviews.Content: Attended a week long conference at the convention center which was across the street. This hotel is very new and is still sparkling. The rooms are a good size and the views of the ocean were quite nice. The pool while quite small is an infiniti pool and is quite dramatic on the fourth floor of the hotel. It was packed on the weekend but I managed to still find a space to work on my tan. As an SPG Platinum I was upgraded to the 12th floor which is the club level. They have a lounge but it is not open on the weekends or after breakfast on Friday. This was disappointing but I guess they don't have much business on that level on the weekends. The lounge when it was open served breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres. Alcoholic drinks were extra but tea, coffee, juice, soda etc were free. The selection for breakfast was a simple continental spread. The evening spread was limited but had a few hot dishes and various vegetables for dipping. I ate lunch at the hotel twice, once at the pool where it was naturally quite expensive but it was quite good. Lunch inside was a similar menu but not much cheaper so would recommend the pool bar. Biggest issue I experienced with the hotel was with the slow service by the front desk. It seems they were understaffed with usually only 1 staff person and that caused a lot of delays. The other problem which might have been a computer issue was not recognizing SPG status even after reminding them of this. It required my logging into my SPG account to show the Platinum status as they couldnt see the status in their system. All in all a good hotel in an area that is in the process of being redeveloped. Some new restaurants coming soon which will improve dining choices. Old Town was a mere 10 mins away by cab and I highly recommend going there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel If You Have A Car”
Reviews.Author: Melike2travel
Reviews.Content: This is another Hotel that charges a Resort fee of $15.00 for nothing but what should be in the normal cost of the Hotel. That being said this is a true 4 star hotel, everything is done right. The things I like are the rooms, the business center ( lots of computers), the Casio and the pool area. Things I did not like $16.00 to park, $15.00 resort fee and this place is like an island there is nothing but the Convention Building for at least a half a mile. Someday things are going to build up around it but not soon. You either need a car with GPS or lots and lots of money for Taxi's. The nearest beach is at the Hilton and its man-made.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU LEAVE A DEPOSIT WHEN CHKING IN DONT EXPECT TO GET IT BACK AT CHK OUT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tookute4u83
Reviews.Content: I am livid that i paid for my trip through travelocity thinking everything was fine then while checking in at the front desk they tell me i need to leave a $100 deposit i dont know what for anyway i gave them my debit card and was told that the $ would be released on my debit card within 48- 72 hours it was not so i call to question than i was told it can take 15 days with a debit card so i waited 15 days passed and i called again and told it can take 31 days, then after that someone called me telling me it would be on my card within 6 hrs and it was not i feel i am getting the run around from this hotel and that they do not want to give me my $ back this is unprofessional and i am about to take legal action it should not take this long to credit $ back to a card. so beware if you are asked to leave a deposit.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bluebell55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the day before and the day after our cruise. The rooms are clean and well appointed but that is the end of the good news. The breakfast buffet was absurdly expensive and mediocre at best. The rest of the food was good but expensive. The pool was cold (and I'm from Canada!) and no one was using it for that reason. When we checked out at 3:30 am for our 6am flight we couldn't believe the noise from the lobby. As we entered the lobby the music was pounding. We approached the desk and couldn't find an attendant. I tried to ask another patron who was also puzzeled as to where the desk staff was but we literally could not communicate. The music was that loud. At night they pull a cutain across the middle of the lobby and turn half the lobby into a disco. I entered the room behind the desk and found an employee and asked to check out. I yelled to her that the music (noise) was ridiculous and she agreed. How the hotel can expect anyone to work in that environment is beyond me. We left the hotel in a cab and wound our way through many drunks vacating the disco. Some were close to falling down. The hotel is a fifteen dollar cab ride to Old San Juan or the Cruise Ship Terminal. It's a cab to go anywhere. Nice clean hotel but too many negatives to make me stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to start and end your Puerto Rican Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Paula60763
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent two nights at the Sheraton before we headed out for the beaches, islands and rainforest. After a week of touring, we returned for a final night at the Sheraton before our return to New York. It was a great way to began and end our trip. The hotel is cosmopolitan and upscale with all the amenities one needs to relax. We were roughing it out on the road and when we returned at the end of our excursions, the hotel served as a segue back to our more urban lives. I also booked a massage and facial at the Zen Spa when we returned, to really add the icing on the cake. The staff was great and we loved the pool and hot tub. Would highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “I don't usually complain but this place is rediculous!”
Reviews.Author: gwsimon
Reviews.Content: I couldn't beleieve this place, we arrived on a Saturday and checked in. Waited in line fifteen minutes to check in. Rooms weren't ready so we waited in line to checked our bags at the front desk another 20 minutes. We were hungry looking for somewhere to eat lunch, they had a cafe right there by the lobby so we thought we would try it. Food was ok but the service was horrible. They were setting up a stage and sound system for a show that evening which wasn't a bad thing until they started doing sound checks. Their sound checks were screeching, and I am talking ear piercing, sounds of static. We were seated right in front of the stage and sound system. When we complained they said they would be finished in a few minutes. They paid for our last round of drinks as we left the resturant which consisted of one mixed drink ($13) (btw beers were $6 each). We had 7 in our party, 4 adults, two teenagers and one child. Lunch tab was $265.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- But in the Middle of Nowhere”
Reviews.Author: yumyum90
Reviews.Content: I received this hotel on a blind bid from Hotwire to stay in before our cruise. At first I was excited because I read it was right across the street from the pier and it is. As I sat by the infinity pool I could see the cruise ships. Unfortunately it's still a $15 cab ride over there because of the street design its difficult to walk safely. As for the hotel we checked in around 4pm and went up to our room. The room looks exactly like the pictures. We then went outside to try to catch the bus to Condado. For some reason every bus that came said they were not going to Condado even though that's what was written on the bus sign. So, many potential bus riders just sat in confusion for quite awhile. After about 45 minutes we gave up and decided to take a cab. Condado is about 2 miles away just over the bridge by the HIlton and that was a $15 cab ride. We got some food and then came back to the hotel. I must re-iterate there is nothing around this hotel. Do not stay here if its your first time in Puerto Rico because it will not give you a good feel of what the island is like. Instead you should stay at the Shearaton in Old San Juan so you can be near any and everything as well as experience true Puerto Rico and you won't have to take a cab to find food. After returning from Condado there wasn't much else to do so we just went to bed. My only pet peeve with the room is elevator noise. We weren't even anywhere near the elevator but all night long as it moved up and down it sounded like there was construction going on. It was pretty annoying. For breakfast the next morning we decided to eat downstairs in the restaurant instead of paying $30 to get a cab to eat in town. We had about a 50 minute wait since there aren't any other restaurants in the area every hotel guest comes downstairs to eat. You will spend a minimum of $20 for one person for breakfast if you get a single item and some juice. Your better off spending $25/pp to get the buffet because juice is also included. A small glass of juice by itself is $4. The service here was okay, its just extremely crowded on the weekend due to the cruisers. I would only reccommend that you stay here if your flight gets in late at night and you are leaving on a cruise the next day. Otherwise you miss out on so much!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wnykag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before going on a cruise. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was bright and clean with a great view of the harbor and Old San Juan. The only drawback is the location, you need a taxi or rental car to get anywhere, but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff, great hotel, challenging location”
Reviews.Author: Jpowers
Reviews.Content: I have yet to stay at a hotel with a better staff. I know management is very attentive to this, and must cite Agmel, amongst others. The hotel staff was exceptional from the time we met with the bellmen, the 3 desk agents, the pool bartender, the spa, and finally the two hostesses and waiter at Choices. The hotel is classy, well done. The pools on the 4th floor include and infinity pool overlooking the cruise ships and yacht harbor. Music is piped in, and it is spacious with a bar and food service. The location is a challenge. Taxi to Old Town is easy to get, but $15 ech way. Rooms are great! It is the perfect escape after the cramped quarter of the cruise ship. The workout room was exceptional! Did I mention how amazing each and every one of the hotel staff were? Seriously! Remarkable! I am very thankful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, location lacking amenities”
Reviews.Author: hdhinaz
Reviews.Content: This seems to be a popular hotel with cruise ship passengers. We arrived in the afternoon, and the bellmen were very helpful with our luggage. They assisted us into the lobby and offered assistance getting to our room when we were ready. There was a long line, but the check in process went relatively quickly. The room was prepaid with my airline miles, I always worry that something went wrong in the reservation process, but all was good. Our room overlooked the bay. It was very clean, the ammenties were good and it was definitely Sheraton quality. There was a restaurant and a bar offering tapas in the hotel, but that was it. There was really nothing else within walking distance, except for a little cafe across the street. We could see the cruise ships from our window, but they were not within walking distance. They are developing the area, and when they are finished I think it will be prime location. The restaurant was very expensive, and very slow. Our very handsome and charming waiter, Luis, brought us a complementary desert to make up for the 45 minute wait for our food. It was very easy to get a taxi the next morning to Old San Luis, and the hotel stored our luggage until we returned to pick it up in the afternoon. When the area around the hotel is fully developed, I would highly recommend it. Until then, the Sheraton Old San Luis seems like a better option.

Reviews.Title: “lagoon view?”
Reviews.Author: prbocagirl
Reviews.Content: On arrival my lagoon view which I paid extra for was not available. I was told that I was receiving an upgrade to the club level. Funny cause the club level stuff is closed on the week end and we were told we could not use it anyway. Soo check out the picks of our view, nice ha... NOT! a dump!!!!!!!!!!. Other that that the hotel is nice, casino is good. Pool is freezing and very small And walls paper thin you will hear everything even if someone is using a hair dryer next door. Oh and not vent in bathroom so if you feel gassy and are shy send your guest for a walk or blast the TV while you are in there.

Reviews.Title: “Liars”
Reviews.Author: Dwdowining619
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying the staff at this hotel are friendly and wonderful. However, if a mistake is made promises are made that are NOT kept. They will tell you anything to make you leave the front desk to try to get others checked in quickly but the follow through is horrible. They do not get back in touch with you. We had misc charges on our bill that we caught only because we asked to see the folio ahead of time. We did this because the check in took over 4 hours and because we had to catch a plane we wanted to make sure check out went smoothly. It would not have if we had not spent an hour of our time the day before checking the folio and having them remove misc charges. The area around the hotel is NOT developed. They show pictures of shops and eateries but these are really all empty. The "CLUB" in the hotel does not exist. There is no dancing. The specials advertised never take place, $20 for all you can drink champagne if you're a lady, don't count on it. The sushi bar we never saw open once. If it is advertised or promised to you don't expect it. I feel bad because the staff works so hard and is so friendly but the management does not keep their word. This hotel stays up because of the convention center, the friendly staff and their contract with the cruise lines. Do NOT stay here if you can help it. It will not meet your expectations. If you're a business traveler it's fine but if you're planning an event or a wedding beware. They will say anything to get you to book. Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me. I was fooled once and will NEVER go back and stay here again. I will try to get every person I know to NEVER stay here. I would rather pay more to stay somewhere where integrity and honesty mean something. I have stayed at several Sheratons and this is by far the most up set I've ever been after having stayed somewhere. It is a nice hotel, a nice spa, a nice staff. It's too bad that the upper management don't have a conscience. Don't say one thing and do another. Once trust is broken it is nearly impossible to get back. Although I know this was a specific location it made me doubt the Sheraton brand in general. It just goes to show that hiring the right people can make or break a business. Sometimes a trusted name like Sheraton can keep a location open based on the trust and reputation that other Sheratons have worked hard to build. It is sad that one bad apple can spoil the whole bunch. PLEASE do not stay here until they make a change.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheets don't fit the bed! Its all in the details!!!”
Reviews.Author: TShip
Reviews.Content: WOW! a nice impression at first. It was after midnight when we arrived and the front desk staff was great! The lobby is nice and the room was selected for us to allow for a view and a terrace. The disappointment was at 2 AM when I realized the sheets on the bed were too small and had come loose at each corner. I had to get up and leave my partner in that bed and head for the other bed in the room. This was no Westin bed!! The only other disappontment was the bad pizza and the 2 glasses of wine for $60! They even tacked on a room charge for $7.50! Good God! Its all in the details!!! I'd pass next time.

Reviews.Title: “In The Middle of No Where... Only stay here if you don't want to go to the beach, eat bad hotel food and have to get in a taxi t”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveler26
Reviews.Content: We have one more night at this hotel and can't wait to go. I've spent more money staying at this hotel than I would have had I booked at the Ritz. A few traps to watch out for at this hotel... - We upgraded to a Club Room for about $50 per night to get Club access with free internet and continental breakfast. Beware continental breakfast is only served Monday-Friday in the club lounge. So if you're here for a weekend trip skip the club rooms. The internet never worked! - Like every review of this hotel watch every bill. Gratuity was already on most bills. - Taxis- from this hotel you have to take a taxi everywhere. A 10 minute trip is between $12 and $20 per direction. To get to a beach, get back to the hotel from the beach, then go out for dinner and get back to the hotel you should just budget for an additional $80 a day for Taxis All in all only stay at this hotel if you're about to get on a cruise ship or if you're here on a convention that is at the hotel, otherwise pay a little more and stay in Condado or Isla Verte areas then at least you'll feel like you're on a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at an inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: Lalejandro
Reviews.Content: If you are coming on a business trip and you are not coming to the Convention Center then choose the Double Tree at Condado. Other than the location I have no complaints. The hotel is brand new and the room is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but it's no Caribe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: elman
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I stay at this Sheraton and I must say that the hotel is vey nice. Clean, new and with a nice pool. However, if you can stay at the Caribe Hilton do so. Last time I was in Puerto Rico (oct 2010) I stayed at the Caribe Hilton. The room was clean and the bathroom was huge!!! What sold me on the Caribe Hilton is the fact that they have a private beach and it is spectacular. The only con is that the Caribe Hilton does not have a casino and the Sheraton does. Personally, I am not a big gambler so that does not matter to me.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and nothing else around”
Reviews.Author: dreimer043
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre cruise. We had a late flight and got to the hotel after 1:00 am, the lobby was bustling even at this late hour. There really is nothing in the immediate area and we were hungry, they did offer 24 hour room service but it was pricey but good food. The next day we hung by the beautiful pool before heading over to the ship, which was rigiht across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IowaTraveler76
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Caribe Hilton one week earlier, I was hoping for a better experience. This hotel was awesome in every way. The service we experienced was great, top notch. We came with bags in hand from the cruise boat on Sunday morning around 10am. I was so happy to be accomodated and put into our rooms around noon! With a check in time of 3 pm I was very happy. While we waited we went up to the 4th floor pool terrace area. The view of the cruise boats and Old San Juan was great and the infinity pool was very sharp. Everyone loved it. There was plenty of shade and even several private cabanas available. We got lunch from the pool bar/ restaurant area and were very happy with the food and service, excellent choices and better than expected food quality and price. A great start. The rooms are very modern in decor and look very trendy and chic. There is plenty of room and the furniture is very good quality. A Sony flat panel TV? I was impressed. The benefit of staying in a hotel that is only 1 year old! We left the hotel to go back and tour El Morro, and returned around dinner time. We got back to the welcoming hotel and settled in for dinner in the lounge area of the lobby rather than the restaurant. It was another great dining experience. The menu was diverse, the food was of great quality and the drinks were excellent. The archetecture of the lobby bar with its changing LED lights and hanging chandelier was awesome, again very trendy and chic. There is also a very nice casino in the lobby area if you into that. The next morning we had a great breakfast in the Flavors restaurant in the lobby. Again, we had great service, and good mix of local and traditional breakfast fare and a fair price. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The location is convenient to Old San Juan by taxi and the hotel itself is really all you need right there.

Reviews.Title: “Near Princess Pier”
Reviews.Author: BeachLover081
Reviews.Content: Booked on hot-wire and was worried about location. Nice bar outside. $12 cab to Old San Juan. Only thing lacking was a a refrigerator in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise or Business Only - not for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: KLHodge
Reviews.Content: Booked a package with AAA and the Sheraton was picked due to price, breakfast included and it had a beautiful pool. We figured why pay the price of the Resort Area when the Sheraton had a great view, and included all the above. Arrived, the pool was closed till the last full day of our stay, due to emergency repairs. After 2 hours of back and forth between AAA and the Sheraton we were given a room upgrade - balcony - which was very nice. The hotel in itself is very nice and the staff was friendly and did their best to accomodate us, however it is best for one night cruise stays or business, due to location at the convention center, not for longer stays of more than one or two nights. And when we did go to the pool, hot tub on Friday, the hot tub was cold. Not what one hopes for after a full day of hiking.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile great hotel great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Spgmike
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife and we had a great time there. The bar was really nice the roof top pool was great although it was closed part of the time. When we arrived the bell boy, victor, was awesome he had a smile on his face every single time I saw him he was extremely helpful and knowledgable he even got us ice once he helped us with our bags. Great beggining to our stay. The only down side to this property is the tv's they do not have ondemand. But I would definately go back

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were nice but food to expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Anne_Lucille
Reviews.Content: If you are staying for a night before cruising I would recommend it! The rooms are nice hotel built a year or so ago! It wouldn't hurt if they put some money into landscaping the area! There are (2) restaurants I forgot the name of the one with the buffet but the food served there is much better than what the bar serves! Breakfast Buffet is grat! The bar right off the main lobby food is to high and service is slow! Chicken wings (12) $20, hamburger $15! Not that I would mind paying for it but wasn't impressed with quality of food! They have a Sushi Bar in the Casino but that closes early. Not to many restaurants in the area within walking distance! Very noisy at night! It is a casino! The hotel is (10) minutes from Departure Ports of Call for Carnival, Royal Caribbean, etc. A lot of over priced spanish cruisine on the bars menu! They need to give better proportions for the price! Take a lot of small bills with you for tipping! $2 per bag for luggage from Taxi to your room! Cost w luggage from hotel to cruise ship $17.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, in the Middle of No where”
Reviews.Author: DrAjay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Jan, 2011. We got a good rate via our AARP membership, costing an average of $150.00 per night incl. of tax (25%). The size of the rooms and bathrooms was good (as compared to a boutique Bread & Breakfast Inn, we checked out in a more touristy area of Condado), clean and typical of such chain hotels. Its appointments, carpeting, ambience etc. were dull. Beds and pillows were too soft. No fridge or microwave in the room. Breakfast menu prices were high. This hotel is located near the Convention Center. There is no life near by within walking distance. Although it boasts of the largest casino in town, it is very small by Vegas standards with tightly spaced arcade like slot machinesand only a few blackjack or other gambling choices. Rate of return was not posted. The hotel is truly in the middle of nowhere if you do not have a car (parking is $$), other than the next door Convention Center. The area of Condado (~3 miles away, across the bay where cruise ships park) is more modern, tourist friendly with a busy night life and lots of restaurants. It is a better area to stay. Condado is $12 by taxi fron this Sheraton or 50 cents by bus (~ every 20 minutes outside of Sheraton, bus service stops after 9:00 PM). Accessing the interesting city of Old San Juan is also same price by taxi or bus (on same bus route and frequency). For value conscious, we recommend staying in Condado area and visitng old San Juan by bus during the day and sticking around in Condado after 8:30 PM. Cruise ships dump lots of tourists in the area every day in peak seasons. You have a good possibility of negotiating favorable rates with smaller, private inns and hotels even in peak season. We recommend visitng, Fort El Morro, St Christobal and walk in Old San Juan on your own steam. No need of guided tours ($53.000 pp) - which in our opinion, offer diminished returns to your $. We felt that the National Park service does an outstanding job for our tax$ and in providing information enthusiastically (frequent orientation talks for free). Ticket is $5.00 for 1 week pass for both forts - an exceptional value! The trolleys in Old San Juan are free - hop on hop off, though irregular in schedule. All beaches are free. We paid ~$75.00 pp by guided tour and van transportation to El Yunque Rain Forest (preserved and serviced by National forest service) and Loquilo Beach. it could have been as easily done by renting a car locally (free parking & admission at El Yunque and Loquilo Beach). At night, you can drive off to the Luminiscent biobay and rent Kayak yourself (save the cost of guided tour ~100.00 pp). (We did not get to do this bit unfortunately), One must visit the National El Yunque rain forest. The Federal Govt. does excellent job here for the tax $. They forests are absolutely gorgeous, a must see treat.

Reviews.Title: “Beware hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: GGOT
Reviews.Content: We were snowed out of our return from Vieques to New York City and got stuck in San Juan for one night.
