Being Starwood Preferred Guests we called the Sheraton and booked for one night. The next morning the bill showed a "service charge" of almost 30 dollars and this was above and beyond the tax. We asked about it and were told because this is a business hotel they can add the service charge. We asked for it to be removed since it was not quoted in our price and they refused. Breakfast was horrible, terrible food and lousy service. Concierge recommended a restaurant for dinner and gave the wrong address. Only thing worth it is the free internet in the rooms. Worst Sheraton we've stayed at. Will not return but it doesn't seem to bother anyone at this hotel seeing all the previous bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “noisy, isolated, expensive: cannot recommend”
Reviews.Author: svwriter2
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Juan on 1/14 and took a van/cab (10 pieces of luggage, 5 people) to the Sheraton Puerto Rico Resort and Convention Center, a hotel recommended by our travel agent for its proximity to the ship. Traffic was horrendous with many roads blocked off, presumably because it was St.Sebastian Day weekend, the equivalent in P.R. to New Yearâ€™s. In checking into the hotel we noticed groups of teenage girls congregated in the lobby. They appeared to be between 16 and 18 years old, max. The only restaurant open for the evening was Choices. It provided a varied menu of Puerto Rican specialties and traditional favorites. They even prepared a grilled checken breast on spinach for my mom, to conform with her low salt diet. The bill was high but the food was good. Our rooms were minimalist modern and new. The hotel was isolated in a business park that was obviously unfinished, with ivy growing over the half built structures. This meant that there was no where to walk, nothing around the hotel. That was ok, we all needed to go to sleep. Wrong. The teenage girls multiplied into a loud, raucous party under our windows on the 7th floor, that kept all 5 of us awake until 5:30 am. They were obviously drinking, playing loud music, and shrieking. Occasionally it would die down, and then the shrieks would return. As we were checking out my brotherinlaw, a very mild mannered person normally, complained forcefully. He was right. The hotel has to decide whether it wants local, disruptive, underage parties, or upscale cruise industry customers. We spent well over $1000 for one nightâ€™s lodging and dinner. I took up the cause and mentioned that my 90 year old mom had been one of those affected. The front desk offered a 50 per cent discount, but the rooms were prepaid. I have referred the matter to my travel agent and American Express. The discussion will continue. Do not stay here, you can do better in Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, helpful staff, wish we stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Jerseygirlmomof4
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before our cruise started. The hotel is right next to the convention center and there is no way to walk to anything but it is a short drive and pretty easy to get around. There is plenty of food and things to do in Old San Juan but if you are looking to stay in Old San Juan then you want the other Sheraton. That one is right in the heart of the quaint city. The pool was beautiful, my only complaint was that it closed pretty early and by the time we were done dinner there was little time for swimming and relaxing. Also we were unable to use the hot tub as the shut it down just as we were getting there. That was disappointing but we did enjoy the pool. There were plenty of lounge chairs and towels by the pool. The restaurant was very nice for being a hotel restaurant. The service was wonderful and the food was good. It was a very pleasant start to our vacation. The hotel seemed to be very new and was beautiful inside and out. Our bed was very comfortable the room was large and we had an excellent view of the pool and the harbour area. When we went to bed we saw a few cruise ships and when we woke up we saw different ones. *One note about Old San Juan, we felt VERY safe during the day but we were told not to be there at night. On our night leaving on the cruise there we helicopters and a lot of police activity for what seemed like over an hour. It was halloween night and that may have had something to do with it. We never left the touristy section of the city and we never had any problems. If you are renting a car and have some time there is a little beach on your right hand side as you enter Old San Juan, you might miss it if you are going too fast. It is a really pretty little beach with bathrooms (never went in to see how they were) and showers outside. The water was a beautiful color, the beach was clean. So glad we stopped to put or feet in. Wish we were able to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with an amazing and always-helpful staff..you feel at home"”
Reviews.Author: Adventure-Traveler27
Reviews.Content: Earlier I was a little skeptical on the location of this hotel as it is a little away from the old town. If you are there for business, convention then it is perhaps a practical location. However, when you are in Puerto Rico, you also want to play after work..However, the facilities within the hotel is very good. It is almost self-suffcient and you can hang out at the bars. Wish it would have more energy and life. Most guests go out to old town. I think the hotel can perhaps have a live band etc once in a while to make it more attractive. Casino is good. HAving said the above, I still rate my stay at this hotel as one of the best! And the whole credit goes to the amazingly helpful and always smiling and hard working staff. I (and many of my colleagues) had my flight canceled due to snow-storms and the hotel front desk staff were very very helpful in accomodating us for additional nights (despite the hotel being full). More specfically, someone from the front desk by the name # Grissel Rivera was amazingly supportive and helpful. She not only handled our multiple requests and hunderds of questions with great patience and efficiency but also knew exactly how to deal with some demanding customers! Man, it is tough to keep smiling and servicing even if the customer makes unreasonable deamands..If you get serviced by Grissel then you should just relax and enjoy your stay in Puerto Rico...you know you will be in good hands...There is another staff member who was very helpful but I don;t recall her name. If Sheraton has such amazing people servicing the customers, you can be rest assured your stay will be very comfortable! Overall, I liked the hotel because of its amazing staff (as mentioned above) and food, cozy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints, Nice Stay For a Night”
Reviews.Author: dsl82899
Reviews.Content: Hi all, me and my wife stayed at this Sheraton on Jan 1st for our early arrival to embark on the RCI Serenade. We read a lot of reviews and were a little nervous, but this hotel really had no minor issues at all for us. We arrived late around 11pm, we were promptly greeted, had our bags taken loaded on to a card and taken to the front desk area for check in. We checked in with no problems, less than 5 minutes and the lobby was very crowded. Too funny, I was even slightly scolded for trying to take our bag cart to the elevators to drop them off in the room, he said leave them and we did just that. The hotel is modern, clean and has a nice atmosphere, it is not traditional Spanish, but quite contemporary. If you want that old world feel go to the crowded Old Town or one of the out of city hotels!! We had a drink at the stylish bar before heading to our rooms, yes, the drinks are $15 each, and we had a bad martini the first go round, but we simply told the bartender we did not like it and he made a new one which was very good.... not sure what others expect, drink prices in any popular tourist destination like San Juan are not cheap. We headed up to our rooms, our bags were there, and no extra fee or bell person waiting for a tip either... The room was quite nice, all the ammenities needed and a few extras like an ipod station and Starbucks coffee. The room was very clean, comfortable, large and had an easy to use safe for your valuables. The view was overlooking the island airport and the 5 ships in port for the Sunday embarkation. I have zero negative to say about the accommodations. We did not use the pool so I can not comment on the open or close times, although it is a beautiful pool and pool area, even for being a convention center hotel this was a nice way to make you feel more tropical. We did not get food at the hotel, we took the whopping 7 minute cab ride to the Old Town for local food, the cab ride was $15-16, I forget, but I even forgot my camera in the hotel and the driver took us all the way back and did not charge us any extra. We left our bags in the area where they check them for guests checking out but wanting to see the city, their was no fee for this and they were guarded by a bellman and we simply gave a modest tip, but no hassell or pressure. I wrote such a long review because we are picky people, but don't expect perfection either and this hotel delivered for what we needed. If you stay here and expect beach front or to be in the Old Town you did not do your research, so stop complaining and learn from your mistake!!!

Reviews.Title: “not "close" to anything”
Reviews.Author: katytudi
Reviews.Content: We spent New Year's Eve at the Sheraton Convention Center, thinking it would be close to old San Juan and Condado. . . and for a $12 cab ride each way, it is. But, you can't walk to or from it to anywhere but the convention center. So, it's like being on an expensive and rather limited island on the island. Even the beach isn't close, despite the "bay view." We did have a good time NY Eve because we wanted to have a good time. . . but the party at the Sheraton was cheap, but not inexpensive: mostly disco noise at highest volume in multiple ball rooms. Many people were complaining. The one live band, which was a good salsa band, played one set, then back to a DJ. All the tables and chairs were reserved (not included in the $90 tickets) in the only room with salsa dancing. Yep, nowhere in the ballroom to sit. [ Oh and the hotel took no responsibility for the party they hosted.] The room was clean, well appointed and comfortable. If you love Sheraton hotels and don't really want to see anything else in San Juan, maybe this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL SHERATON STAY”
Reviews.Author: shantelleary
Reviews.Content: Why NOT to stay at the Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel and Casino: 1) The pool closes at 8pm (every other hotel pool in Puerto Rico closes at 10pm or 12pm) and the hotel bar closes at 6pm. 2) Everything that my family (all 4 grown adults) tried to order at the bar and grill was OUT...from chicken to shrimp to chips. 3) The hotel is no where near Old San Juan or the beaches. You must take a bus or taxi for 20 minutes to get to Old San Juan or Isla Verde. 4) Surcharges and service fees for everything and charged to your room. 5) Expensive food and drinks, not worthy of their high prices. $15 for drinks and $25 dollars for simple breakfast in the morning. 6) Staff couldn't keep up with busy time periods or when cruise clients arrived for the nights. Had to wait long periods to eat or be helped because couldn't keep up with crowds. 7) There is NO CLUB LOUNGE on the 12th floor. No difference between VIP 12th floor and the remaining floors. We paid for the club package for h'orderves and drinks on our floor, and all of that closed down 7 months ago, so we were out that additional package. 8) They promise a room credit, and then don't give it to you. 9) THE WHIRLPOOL DOESN'T WORK 10) No caring staff. Money sucking and annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you are on a convention....”
Reviews.Author: CoconutmonkeyGB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before and after a cruise, as a package with Virgin Cruises. The room is well set out, minimalist and clean. The cost of our package included breakfast, however the hotel clearly does not have the ability to cater for a large number of their guests having breakfast, particularly on a weekday, when 'full service' equates to a very long wait to get a table and then get served. The staff were friendly enough but clearly were unable to cope with this, resulting in us waiting around 30 minutes on 2 occasions just to get a table. The room, although very pleasant is not great in terms of sound insulation, and we had two disturbed nights out of three due to outside noise from the hotel- pack your earplugs!! We also were advised on our second stay that we would not be able to use the pool area after 4pm, because of a private function. Although this may have been a one off, and we were just unlucky we did feel that the large convention bookings were viewed as more valuable than individual guests. The elevators are also wholly inadequate for the hotel, particularly as the pool, gym and meeting rooms are not at ground level, so the wait for an elevator can be prolonged during peak times. On the plus side, the coffee machine is good, and its nice to have complimentary water in the rooms, and the TV is of a good quality and there is an IPOD speaker and charger in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: rlpolobear9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel before leaving for a cruise out of San Juan. The hotel is really new and modern rooms have great vies of the alternate cruise dock (Caribbean Princess, Serenade of the Seas). The pool/ jet tubs on the sun deck are really nice but should be heated as the water was freezing when we where there as the temp was about 75 but due to the location the resort gets a steady breeze. We decided to stay at this hotel over the Sheraton OSJ mainly due to the nicer rooms knowing that we would be in a location out of the way which was fine we just took cabs which where always easy to get. The rooms where spacious and modern, quiet and very clean. The casino and lounge area was very much alive on Saturday night with lots of music and tons of people. I don't gamble but those who where looked to be having a good time. Lounge bar was really classy too.

Reviews.Title: “Worse service !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aqchan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, we walked in the room and saw a bottle of wine on the desk since we are SPG and free Starbucks coffee. However the trip is a nightmare since both of us are physicians. The Internet is FREE but we were unable to download emails from our Outlook Mails even after more than an hour with talking to the ISP. So we went to Starbucks Cafe in Old San Juan; we have no problems downloading our emails. We wind up spending almost 4 hours there. Another major problem is Sheraton encourages GREEN environment conservation and promoted $5 credit if our bedsheets are not changed. So we agree. lo and behold, $5 was not credited to the bill, the room was not cleaned, towels, bath amenities such as soap, shampoo etc were not replaced, no more Starbucks coffee. On our third day here, Internet still not working, Restaurant service was very slow, food was expensive. This place is way over-rated. I would give this hotel and experience a ONE STAR rating and will never come back here nor attempt to book at any Sheraton for a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, Clean, Helpful Staff & Beautiful Pool!”
Reviews.Author: GringaGrrrl
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this new Sheraton property with it's soaring lobby ceilings and warm and helpful staff. Largely used as a business hotel, the rooftop pool area was as chic as any you'd see in a hip Miami hotel. The bar downstairs has open events regularly, the rooms are clean all-white and very modern and the food, while pricey, was pretty good. The location didn't bother me as it's a short bus/taxi ride to Old San Juan, Escambron Beach or the Metro Movie Theatre in Miramar. I felt safe, cared for and happy in this chic cavernous cacoon! Special staff include Elliot/Concierge, Lyseida/Front Desk and JeanCarlo The Bellman! Also, Rodolfo is probably one of the best and most knowledgeable Bartenders on the island, seek him out in the Lobby Bar!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Worst Service”
Reviews.Author: dancingsamuari
Reviews.Content: Beautifully designed hotel. The service was aweful in all areas stood in front of the front reception desk for 5 minutes while 10-12 employess stood around talking ro eaxh other in spanish. No one greated me and said, "We'll be with you in a mimute." it was like we were an inconvienece to them. Same thing at the restaurant. Waited for 10 minutes after being seated before anyone said hi or gave us menus. The restaurant was understaffed both days we went there. On our check out day we had a late check out, after explaining to the housekeeper that we would be leaving at 2pm, she knocked on the door persistantly at 12 and again at 1pm. When checking out, the font desk agent asked my room number 5 times, typing in the wrong number each time, before complaining that she was tired and had a long shift. For the high price point, the service does not come close to what you would expect from the Sheraton brand. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room & views!”
Reviews.Author: tburlamaqui
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights during a business trip to Puerto Rico and was definetely the right choice. The room (935) is enormous and mega confortable. There's a very nice balcony, with great views for a moment of relax. Staff is very profesional and friendly and the all the facilities are brand news. Expect no fuss, this is not a luxury hotel but if you're looking for a very nice room with great service, this is your place. The only con: location. It's great for a business trip as it's just beside the convention center and near the airport but you need a cab to move around the city, Old San Juan, malls, etc. Great find and way much better than Sheraton Old San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: pll2215
Reviews.Content: I loved the Sheraton. We had 2 rooms and 8 people. We were not charged for extra people. The rollaway bed they brought up was nicer that any bed in our home!. We were tired from getting off the ship and it was too early to check in. The staff allowed us to use their roof top pool area. They have a changing room and beautiful sectionals with shades to relax. The pool is amazing. To travel we used the bus. For 1.75 you can go anywhere in San Juan! My husband and I brought 2 suitcases of laundry on the bus. The bus driver was so helpful, the driver showed us where to get off and the laundremat was right there. The convenience store across the street has cheap beer by the can so we sat outside and drank beer while doing laundry. A nice date when you bring 6 kids! I was able to walk from the hotel to the grocery store and buy sandwich stuff. It was a bit of a trek, but I needed the excersize. We also walked to McDonalds for coffee in the morning before the kids got up. Way cheaper than the coffee shop in the lobby. It is fun to listen to locals and see families at these average places. The hotel did not mind all of us eating by the pool area using their tables! We saved a ton of money this way. We booked the room on hotwire for 79.00 a night each. We all want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: mdluv2travl
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, fantastic staff....we loved it! We knew ahead of time it was "out of the way" but it was very easy to get into Old San Juan. We had a top floor room with an outstanding view of the harbour. Our room was spotless with nice decor. We can't say enough good things about the staff, they were so friendly and helpful. Would stay at this Sheraton again for sure! D & M

Reviews.Title: “the rate you paywhen you book won't be the final price....”
Reviews.Author: Seb_In_Kansas
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 3 (2 adults and a 2 year old). We stayed 5 nights at the San Juan Sheraton Hotel and Casino for a conference that my wife was attending during the last week of September. Overall our experience was positive and we were satisfied with the quality of the room and of the services. We had a room with view on the convention center/bay area on the 5th floor. I do have a big comment about the price we paid since I felt a little bit like IT WAS BAIT AND SWITCH. According to the reservation confirmation Email they sent us, we were expecting to pay around $155/nights (room + 11% occupancy tax included (the conference group rate), there was no mention of any other fees or taxes. In fact we paid in the final bill $139 for the room (no breakfast included at that rate), $15.29 for taxes, $15.29 for hotel service fee, $1 tips room attendant, $5 tips Bellman the first day (despite the fact we gave tips to these person on our own accord not knowing they would be tipped from the bill). That end up being a bigger rate than announced with no early disclosure. Another thing is some people at the conference booked their room calling the hotel but not mentioning they were there for the conference and got a rate of $99 a night including breakfast for 2. I am sure they got the same kind of fees hike at their checkout too but they started with a lower base fee. Youâ€™ll imagine that when they have a group rate it should be a better deal than the anybody rate ,no? Next time we go to a conference, weâ€™ll call directly to check the rates of the hotel before using the conference rateâ€¦ A note for people with kids, we were able to rent a mini fridge for $25/night from the hotel and also they sell milk per the liter packs at the gift store. Other note about parking, we were there during the fashion week at the convention center and it did not look like it would have been easy to park a car on the street during these days (just in reference to other reviews about parking at this hotel, you might want to check the schedule of the convention centerâ€¦) I also saw in one of the review that kids eat freeâ€¦ I am not so sure about this since we had to pay for our 2 year old meal (breakfast, lunch or dinner) The hotel looks pretty new and other reviews said it opened in Nov 09. It is located next to the convention center and has a good number of rooms. I guess it is a good place to stay if you go to a convention there. According to my wife, the conference rooms at the hotel are fine (very cold though), but their break accommodations were not too good (food was OK, the coffee was available only at the earliest break in the morning and not at the other breaks). The problem with being located next to the convention center is that the convention center is not in old San Juan. So if you are only coming to do tourism, well you may want to look somewhere else or not complain about taking a mean of transportation to go to Old San Juan. The #21B bus (you have to work with their schedule, but they were clean, safe and relatively fast) is $75cts to go to Old San Juan each way or the Taxi are about $15 with tip each way. The difference is the convenience of the Taxi. We used a combination of both. It is true that around the hotel there is not too much to do. We tried the beaches (very kid friendly) about 20 minute walk from the hotel, but will not really recommend it. First the walk there is along a very busy road and doesnâ€™t really feel safe (and the sidewalks are not in too good shape so it made it difficult with a stroller). Then it might be the day we were there, but there was some kind of gangs there and they started to fist fight in front of everybody, cops started to come but waited to be numerous enough to do anything. My 2 year old was done with that place, and did not want to go back to the beachâ€¦ A word about the elevators. There were 5 of them but only 4 worked and at times when the hotel is busy it was pretty slow traffic ( it had took us more than 10 minutes to go from the lobby to our room at times) The Pools on the 4th floor were nice. Like other review said it consists of an infinity pool overlooking the bay and a kid pool sharing water with the whirlpool area. The whirlpool water wasnâ€™t too hot, about body temperature but it made the kids pool water at a nice temperature (warmer than the infinity pool water) for the young kids. There was also an area with some water fountains were kids can play. Around the pools there was a lot of lounge chairs and lot of room to relax. On a Sunday afternoon though there was a DJ that was palying some loud electronic music all afternoon. It wasnâ€™t that relaxing and there were no towels available at the pool even if we called the lobby multiple time, we had to use our room towels that day. But it might have been just a one day thing linked to the fashion convention since there was also a DJ on the Friday and Saturday nights in the lobby playing the same kind of electronic music very loud up to at least 2 in the morning. We could hear the music from our room on the 5th floor. The good side of this was that there were very good looking people at all these partiesâ€¦ to come back to the pools, there is a bar and grill next to the pools. We ate some decent bar food there, and tried some drinks that were good and priced at price comparable with what we had in other hotels of that class. My big issue with the pool is that it closes at 8:00 pm and there is not even access to the area around the pool after that time. I thought it would be nice to go there to read or relax at night and I would suggest the hotel management that even if they close the pools they should let the bar and the area open up to 10:00 pm to be accommodating with their guest looking for some evening relaxation. We ate at the Choices restaurant in the lobby a few times (a lot to do with the lack of other choices for food places in that area) and were very satisfied with the quality of the food and of the service every time. Prices were a little high but not outrageously and I will say comparable to other hotel of that class. The staff at the restaurant was really accommodating for us and our 2 year old. They all were also very helpful. Couple times we ordered our food to go and they called us when it was ready so we just had to go pick it up downstairs. It was convenient with our toddler that canâ€™t seat for more than 30 minutesâ€¦ We usually do not like to eat too many times in the same place but we had to here, again not because of the hotel but of its location. Even if it is called choices after 5 days we had pretty much tried everything on the menu or at least it all sounded the sameâ€¦. They had a Sunday brunch for about $25 per person, it was good, but the selection of food item was a little disappointing. The Casino was extremely clean, and non smoker, we did spend a little bit of money thereâ€¦. They had live music and also the waitressing staff does little dancing once in a whileâ€¦ In front of the convention center there is a cool water fountain. It is not the Bellagio, but the fountains works with the music, it was a nice show. We could even see it (without the music though) from our room. We did take a tour proposed by the concierge to El Yunke (the rain forest). It was a half day for about $55 per person (free for our toddler). It was fine but next time I think weâ€™ll rent a car and go by ourselves at our own rhythm. I think weâ€™ll get to see more stuff and do more little hikes.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: HDelrio
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Puerto Rico at the Convention Center District is the place to be when in PR, it's minutes away from Old San Juan and Condado. The hotel has a unique pool that overlooks the San Juan Bay area, also has a great casino. Excellent service and tremendous facilities for very reasonable and affordable prices. The modern look of the hotel makes you think you're staying at a five star hotel while paying much more less. As a person who has traveled a lot, I highly recommend staying at the Sheraton Puerto Rico. Finally, the lobby bar appears to be the hot spot for young professionals, it's definitely a "happening" place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Clemerdu
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family stayed for 5 nights at this hotel. The experience was wonderful. I was hesitant to book it when i read a couple of damning reviews. I found they were completely inaccurate. The staff was wonderful. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The hotel was fantastic. The Infinity Pool was lovely. The only down side is that it is not on the beach, but it is a 5 minute drive (15 minute walk) to the beach. Its new, its clean, its family friendly and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wicked Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: actor4omaha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton San Juan for a week on our first trip to Puerto Rice and what a treat. This new hotel is beautiful and has an amazing staff to compliment it. Reading some of the prior negative reviews before our trip I was watching for poor service and other issues to arise. Nothing could be further from reality. This hotel has the most amazing pool. The Infinity pool on the 4th floor overlooks a small airport and little planes taking off and landing, the bay where cruise ships dock and then into Old San Juan. This was the view where I got engaged to the love of my life. Beautiful and romantic. I am not into gambling but the casino is very nice and we put a couple bucks into a couple machines. The staff at the Sheraton was truly amazing. Everyone we ran into was amazing from Justin in the restaurant to the front desk staff, bar staff (one evening bartender at Choices was a bit of a dud) bell staff and a lady on the engineering staff was delightful and stopped to see how our stay was when we met in the hallway. My only complaint about the hotel/staff would be some housekeeping issues. The restaurants are not overpriced for a hotel, in fact the Sunday Brunch was $23.00 and included anything and everything you could want for breakfast including a omelet station. The rooms are very nice and comfy. Nice work desk and free internet!!! You will need transportation to get to "touristy" things, but there is a bus station right next to the hotel that will take you into Old San Juan for $0.75. We did the bus and taxi's for the 1st couple days and then rented a car. There is alot of parking outside the hotel so you don't have to pay for parking. This is a super fine, super slick hotel. Great job Sheraton San Juan!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is my first time to Puerto Rico. The...”
Reviews.Author: MikeRuss1
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to Puerto Rico. The Sheraton is AMAZING. It us only 9 months old and still in grat shape. Incredible infinity pool on the fourth floor, private cabanas, great pool bar with a gastronomic fare. The pool deck is about 10000 sq ft or more( to show the enormity). I called as I wanted to a special week for me and my partner. We gut an upgrade. Erica was a true customer service associate, she welcomed us on arrival was extremely pleasant, cordial and attentive. She gave us ideas of what to do, where to go and how to truly enjoy Puerto Rico. In addition to her warmth and pleasantries, we were surprised with a welcome amenity for my partner. It is his birthday trip. No sooner had I finished settling in and venturing to explore the property, than I met MariCarmen and Leida. These two wonderful ladies were the epitome and true stalwarts of customer service. They stopped at nothing to make us feel special as a gay couple. We were comfortable, safe and relaxed in their presence. They gave us tips in what to do in Old San Juan and Condado. Thanks ladies the Sheraton is proud to have you on their team. And how could I forget Justin in the Choices Restaurant, he was friendly and accommodating. Thanks for the great laughs. All in all we are truly very happy with the Sheraton Puerto Rico and Casino. Thanks for making my week exceptionally special.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Business”
Reviews.Author: RichRR
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find our original hotel (Courtyard) had no power thanks to Hurricane Earl, so we were transferred to the Sheraton Convention Center. This is a new property. The guestrooms are huge and excellent, and the the special rate offered was a plus, especially since the hotel adds on a 14% "Hotel Resort Fee". I would not consider the Sheraton a resort hotel as it's nowhere near a beach, but it seems to be a growing trend as just about all hotels are now charging it. That along with the 11% tax can bust any travel budget. The casino is huge, but the restaurant is hard to find as it is unmarked. Perhaps for the better as the food was overpriced, but typical for a hotel of this category. There is a city bus stop for the #21 bus that takes you to Old San Juan and Condado. Otherwise taxis are $15 flat rate plus $1 per suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Sheraton in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: vacationer16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in mid august. The property is huge and is next the convention center. I found a good deal through Priceline and booked my stay. Hotel charges $15 resort fee per night. Parking is $16 per day, but i was able to park nearby at my own risk and thanks God nothing happened. Rooms are very well appointed, nice furniture and overall very clean. My room was facing the city. Pool is amazing and has a great view of the bay. There is a casino on site that gets very busy during the weekend. Also many locals tend to go in masses to the pool and stay in the hotel overnight. Hotel is located very close to the cruise port, however, there is nothing around. If you are planning to go outside for something to eat, you should get a taxi or either rent a car. Hotel staff was very attentive and polite. Service was very good. I got a late check out without charges. Free wi-fi in rooms and also wired internet was included in the resort fee, as well as water bottles and newspaper. Overall, i had a great stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing Relaxtion”
Reviews.Author: frkrknj
Reviews.Content: Brand new Sheraton opened Nov 09 4th fl pool long narrow pool gives you best view of San Juan, Old San Juan and let's you enjoy the awesome sunsets each night. It has a few flaws, one restaurant, and cab ribes can get expensive. You will need to rent a car to see the sights. (Parking fee $16 a night) Shutle services are being worked on. Next to PR Convention Center. Rooms are nice roomy. Free internet, friendly staff to help you with anything. One drawback, kids eat free. I prefer not to have young children around, too noisy. I'd recommend with reservations. New hotel, some kinks in the link still exist. OH, the Casino, largest on the island- forgetaboutit. Go to the Marriot in Condado- it's the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: milehigh98
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay at the Sheraton. It was clean and comfortable. The first room they gave us did not have a good view so they changed it to a larger balcony with a view of the harbor and it was private. The pool was amazing!! The room service was better than we expected for a hotel. The burgers we ordered from room service were delicious. Our housekeeper was super nice and even put our drinks on ice when we returned from a day out at the pool. Casino staff were all very friendly. We ate sushi at the blackjack table while we gambled....talk about service. Bring your own bottled water...the comped hotel water tasted funny. We stayed while a bbq convention was going on and the hotel got pretty croweded over the weekend which slowed down the elevator service.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: finafinita-
Reviews.Content: can't explain my days there, from moment i walk inn, wow, my really people are working here/ very friendtly there for the people, nice smiles willing to help is incredible, because, i leave in connecticut and i continued been the same ...puertorrican.. and when i go to puertorrico i,m expecting seing my own, they all are there. i will continued going there and hoping keep getting same attention and specials smiles . remenmber one of the guys brought my luggages in he was soo smart i ask myself what this guy doing here he.s personaliyt is highter than a 100 percent but good his there people will come back. i can,t wait to go back soon, on my birthday. but i do have a little recomendation maybe a little better menu outside in the pool area and prices maybee good happy hour everyday would be excellent specially if you stay more than a week.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Never Stay Here Again. Incompetent Management.”
Reviews.Author: kt127
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights. I saw that the hotel was fairly new (<1year) and from the pictures on the hotel web site the hotel looked great. There is no "customer service" at this hotel. I interacted with the management several times and they never were able to address the problems I had. For starters, the hotel charges a 14% "Hotel Service Fee". Not a "resort fee" of $10 or $15 per day, but a % fee. So the higher your room rate, the higher your fee. And what does the fee get you? Well, one thing it gets you is a "daily English language newspaper". That is, unless it's a Sunday....I was told my the manager that "sometimes we don't get Sunday papers in Puerto Rico". Really? Then sometimes you shouldn't charge every guest a service fee for something you are going to deliver. You also may not get your daily paper on Mondays (as in my case), because "it's a hoilday weekend, so there is no paper today". Don't be fooled, this fee is nothing more than a hidden room rate increase. Why can't the hotel just set the per-night rate appropriately, instead of adding on such an obviously bogus fee??? I am in Starwood's Preferred Guest program as a Platinum member (>25 stays per year), so I stay in a lot of hotels. As a Platinum member I am supposed to get a room upgrade ("best available at check-in") and access to the club lounge and terrace (on the top floor). I was really looking forward to using the club lounge, because it looked really nice on the web site and it's a nice perk - breakfast, snacks and drinks throughout the day, hors d'oeuvres in the evening, as advertised on the hotel web site. Well guess what? They had to close the lounge in this 8-month old hotel for repairs. At least that's what I was told the first time. After seeing a group of people on the top floor lounge (from the pool area), I inquired again about the lounge and then I was told "the lounge is booked for a private event". Huh? I thought it was closed for repairs. When I checked out, I again mentioned this to the manager and expressed my displeasure that the lounge was currently being advertised as a perk on their web site, yet I was first told it was closed for repairs and then told it was booked for a private event. Then I get story # 3 - the lounge is closed for the season due to low occupancy, and was booked during my stay for a private event. Low occupancy? I was told by the bellman on the way out that the hotel had been nearly 100% occupied for the last 3 days. 3 stories, not sure any of them are true. And the elevators. There are 5 elevators. You have to take the elevator to get to the pool, which is on the 4th floor. With high occupancy, the wait for an elevator was anywhere from 5-10 minutes. One of the elevators must not have been working, I never saw the door open during my entire stay. That leaves 4 working elevators to use, right? Wrong. It seems when the "private party" booked the lounge, the hotel decided that the private party guests shouldn't have to wait for elevators like the "common" guests of the hotel - so they reserved one of the elevators exclusively for the private party!! How ridiculous is that, make the guests in the other 500 rooms wait even longer so the private party doesn't have to wait to use the elevator. I used each restaurant in the hotel. The food was fine, nothing spectacular, but not bad. However the prices are ridiculous, you'd think you were in NYC. Which is unfortunate because there is NOTHING within walking distance of the hotel. You will definitely need a car (or be prepared to use Taxi's) to do ANYTHING outside of the hotel. My "upgraded room" was a room on the 5th floor (of 12) overlooking the parking garage. Nice. :( The phone in my room did not work. I had to call the front desk on my cell phone and they sent a techie up, who did get the phone working after about 10 minutes. Overall the stay was a huge disappointment. I complained via email and made inquiries to the manager, and have not yet received a response to my questions. (over 3 weeks). Customer service at this hotel is non-existant. Nothing seems to matter, except swiping your credit card, charging outrageous prices for par service (at best), and completely ignoring concerns of the guests. Even without having status in their "preferred guest club" I think the treatment I received was inexcusable. My stay here was a huge disappointment, and I'll never stay at this hotel again. This property could be a great experience if the owners got rid of all the current management, did away with ridiculous 14% fees for nothing, and focussed on treating their guests like guests. A good start would be to respond to emails from guests.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stefi1970
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new, but has a "too modern" style that does not really fit with the fact you are in a Caraibic Island. The rooms are smaller than you would expect in a Sheraton: the furniture is new and pretty stylish but doesn't really leave so much space to move and put your stuff around. The closet is particularly small, but has an iron an iron board - if you suceed to get them out from the closet! The bathroom is as well disappointing for a such new hotel: small, impersonal, cheap quality stuff (plastic top around the sink!!). The only great thing was the bed, as per sheraton standard: extremely confortable, lots of pillow and soft duvet. Other amenities offered for free: a useful safe box, starbucks coffee, a couple of bottled water per day and cable internet connection. BUT there was NOT fridge or minibar in the room, which seemed to us very odd, especially considering that in Puerto Rico the weather is pretty hot all over the year and it would be nice to have a cool drink without calling room service all the time!!! The laundry service is simply awful: we sent some shirts and did not get them back after TWO days, so we called the reception and they told us thet our laundry was ready but they did NOT have ANYONE who can deliver it to our room and the only way in which we can get it was to go down and pick it up by ourself; so I did, I went downstairs and waited 20 minutes on line in the lobby, just to be told that they could not locate our laundry at the moment and that we should wait for have it delivered in room the nexy day!!! (eventually, we get the laundry the following day, but NOBODY from the management even say to us a word for excusing the bad service, and they charged us the full amount even after 3 days!!!). Another negative things is the location: you are in a beautiful caraibic island and all you see from the hotel is an ugly marina and the huge convention center just in fron of the hotel. Even from the "panoramic" pool, the view is quite depressing... The pool and sunbathing area is really disappointing: very crowded, small pool, bad views, bad service at the pool bar. We stayed at the hotel from a tuesday, when the hotel was pretty quite, to a sunday: during the weekend the hotel filled up with a lot of low-level big noisy families (probably attracted by weekend discounted rates) and everything, from the service level to the atmosphere, became even worse. The bar and restaurants can go if you need a quick bite, even overpriced, but for a real meal we strongly suggest to take a taxi and go to old San Juan, where you can also enjoy a walk and great shopping, which is not possible around the hotel. There are much better hotels in Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business - Not close to anything (except Convention Center)”
Reviews.Author: jrodrodriguez
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here from the 2nd to the 6th of July for leisure. Hotel itself is very nice and well appointed but overall suffers from being by itself in the middle of nowhere. Unless you are attending the convention center, or just using it as a base of operations (as we did) you will not find this hotel to your satisfaction. Good points: As mentioned, hotel is very well appointend and beautiful. The infinity pool in the 4th floor is very nice and there are quite a few places where to eat in the hotel. Rooms were large and comfortably appointed. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to help you once they understood what you wanted. The Bad points: Room Care - There seems to be a problem with consistency by the room staff. Not one of the 5 days service to the room produced the same results, and there was something missing every day. I resorted to leaving notes in spanish requesting specifics (which we would get), but other items (for example hand towels, shampoo) would be missing. Not of the items by itself that was severely major, but definitely an annoyance item each day. Food Prices - Only way to describe them is ridiculous. A breakfast consisting of an omelette for my girlfriend, oat meal for me and 2 cups of coffee and 2 glasses of Juice was $46.00 BEFORE tips and tax. We lucked out that we had breakfast vouchers, but still had to pay almost $10 since the vouchers did not cover the cost of the breakfast. Noise - We had two nights where we had to contact the front desk to send security to get roudy neighbors quieted down. The problem with this is that in one case it took almost an hour and a half for the front desk to send someone to check in to the matter. Also, there was a BBQ contest next to the hotel that was broadcasting very loud music, so the competition between the BBQ contest music and the hotel music made it pretty hard to figure out what you were listening to. In summary - I would only recommend this hotel to business personnel attending conferences at the Convention Center for a couple of nights. I would not recommend this hotel for families or romantic outings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: poloshei
Reviews.Content: It was more than I expected... The room with a view of the Convention Center and the San Juan bay was amaizing...I love the service, everyone was so nice. specially the night supervisor at Front Desk ROSEMARY RODRIGUEZ, she made our stay a one to remember...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new hotel, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: traveler_pr_usa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, if you will attend a conference in the Puerto Rico "Pedro Rossello" Convention center I definetly recommend to stay here. This hotel has a lot of amenities and a great view to the cruises port. However, I found the hotel to be pricey and when I was there was just inaugurated and still needed some things. Pool - The infinity pool is just beautiful. At the time of my stay, 2009 new years eve, they throw like three different parties and they were good.

Reviews.Title: “The Awesome Hot Spot.......Loved, Loved, Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MsDelta00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Puerto Rico on our wedding anniversary. If you like a hotel with lots of action you will love this one. It is one of the newest in the area and has a beautiful view of the ports in Old San Juan and located adjacent to the San Juan Puerto Rico Convention Center. The view at night over old San Juan was beautiful. The Casino was beautiful and had lots of machines and tables. During our stay Playboy had a 50th Anniversary Celebration at the hotel, so there were bunnies, expensive cars and people everywhere.......we loved it! Heinekein sponsored a party one night, as well a local prom was hosted there........you chose to be a part of the action or not......it didn't interupt our vacation at all! There were only two comments not as positive about the hotel that I want to share. First the location, There is really nothing within walking distance....you will need to rent a car (we used enterprise) or catch a taxi (very expensive $15-$18 one way)! BUT only rent a car if you can deal with aggressive DRIVING.......It's like New York! The streets of Old San Juan are very narrow and crowded! Use the parking garage in the city ......it is very cheap Second, the hotel check in and out was a little slow.....they needed more attendants to move guests in and out faster. Old San Juan was wonderful, I would recommend Mallorca's for breakfast (reasonably priced), El Hamburger for lunch (reasonable, miniature hamburgers were wonderful), Raices (Roots) for Dinner (reasonable as well, traditional Puerto Rican food). We ate at some different spots, but these were my favorite. The history this city is remarkable. If you visit the forts.....please wear sneakers and prepare for a workout.......I know the soilders the manned these forts back in the day had to be in shape!!!!! OMG! Kite flying at El Morro was a site to see.....they were everywhere. We LOVED our trip to San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: ko456
Reviews.Content: The hotel is super nice, the staff is not! We were treated in a very rude manner by more than one staff while checking in. Upon check in we were confused about the resort fees because another member of the staff had told us they were service fees. We didn't have a problem paying the fees the problem was that no one could tell us what resort fees were and service fees were and I didn't really want to get stuck paying both. Later we found out they are the same thing, well it would be nice to let someone working the front desk know that. The one girl had an attitude and even rolled her eyes at us. The pool is very nice but doesn't stay open past 8pm which is inconvenient for those sight seeing all day and then wanting to spend some time in the pool. Our room was very clean but not very sound proof. While in the bathroom you could hear the people in the room next to ours. There are two restaurants and room service but all three are very over priced. We didn't rent a car so it was difficult to take a taxi just to a restaurant to eat dinner and then come back with out spending a minimum of twenty dollars on taxi fares. If you're going to stay here go buy a Styrofoam cooler for about five dollars at the grocery store and use that in the room instead of paying $25 a day for a fridge in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Another Fabulous Weekend at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Manny032
Reviews.Content: Once more I was invited by the Department of Education and FLICK, a professional educational company based in Florida for another stay at the Sheraton. The check-in went smoothly. As a matter of fact, I actually called to inform that I was checking in later and when I approached the front desk at 8:00pm, the whole process did not take more than 5 minutes. The room was cozy and business-like, just what I needed for weekend workshops. The location of the hotel is excellent. You are just minutes away from the San Juan area and 10-15 minutes from the airport. This is my second weekend at the hotel, and there was nothing I did not like. I did have a mild discussion with the parking service manager about my stay. I was charged for my parking during the first night because the company sponsoring the event had not registered the contract yet, but I was reimbursed when I checked-out. I was able to take a dip at the pool. You feel like you are on top of the world. You can actually see the cruise ships coming in and out of the port. I wouldn't mind spending another weekend or two at the Sheraton. I congratulate management for their excellent service! Manuel Hernandez Carmona,[---]

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Juan - great room - service - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bkam00
Reviews.Content: While I may not rate this as a 5 star hotel for United States standard, the Sheraton San Juan Casino is by far the best hotel in the area. The hotel is brand new, clean room and great service. The staff also seem to be up to par with US staff. The only con is its location. However, this is great for business trip and family trip if you do not mind driving to Condado or Old San Juan to experience the night life. I have stayed at the Renaissance property in San Juan, and the customer service is by far better at the Sheraton Puerto Rico Casino. I will definitely come back to the Sheraton Puerto Rico Hotel, especially for business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Hotel with Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: RocherTP
Reviews.Content: I was told this hotel was only 6 months old (as of May, 2010). The lobby was absolutely stunning, and the hotel bar and restaurants were beautiful. Neither I nor my boyfriend is a gambler, but we did stroll into the casino area. It was clean and a lot quieter (and much much smaller) than those in Las Vegas. I had a super annoying reservation glitch (thanks to one of those online booking websites), but a gentleman at Front Desk was apologetic and courteous; the hotel even offered us a free upgrade! The room was immaculate and beautifully decorated. The fitness room was one of the best and most equipped ones I ever saw. The hotel's infinity pool was gorgeous. The restaurant (not the sushi bar) offered some seriously tasty dishes. We loved, loved, LOVED everything about the hotel EXCEPT for its location. The hotel is standing in the middle of nowhere. (Well, it is standing right by a beautiful convention center). Unless you have a car or are willing to take a bus, riding a cab is the only option for your transportation, which can be pretty costly. My boyfriend and I love mingling with the locals, so taking a bus didn't bother us at all (even though the hotel discouraged and warned us...) As we saw many cranes, In a few years, the hotel will be (hopefully) surrounded by a lot more hotels, restaurants, and shopping areas. If you don't mind being a bit away from Old San Juan, this hotel is perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but brutally isolated”
Reviews.Author: BDfromDC
Reviews.Content: Your really can't fault this beautiful new hotel and it's exceptional staff. I travel every second week and I don't think I've ever had a better serviced room by Housekeeping. My only complaint would be the food is grossly overpriced, and while very good in the restaurant my room service meal was almost inedible. The hotel is very isolated from the rest of the city and there is nowhere you can walk to eat, which obviously has something to do with those restaurant prices. Lovely pool deck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- rent a car though”
Reviews.Author: JohnJohn0426
Reviews.Content: Hotel was real nice--staff was good- we especially loved the service around the pool. We ate at the pool bar and thought the food was WAY Overpriced and not good, the bartender wasnt so nice, but the waitstaff- so friendly and attentive. The hotel is what it is : a convention center hotel--there is nothing to do there. The casino is small- we found that to be the case most everywhere in San Juan though. We rented a car from "Charlies rent a car" - yes from Charlies- look it up--prices were great- they were flexible and we had no issues. Parking on the street near the hotel was a breeze too- we did not use the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: sherylync
Reviews.Content: My husband enjoyed our time at this hotel! The service was great. The food at the restaurant was very good! The rooms are beautiful. The infinity pool was great as well. Can't forget Zen Spa! Had an incredible spa manicure that lasted 1 hour and 15 minutes. We had read reviews of this hotel and there seem to be alot of negative feedback. We started searching around for other hotels and then decided, why not go and see what happens! Well it was the best move! It was all great! I would definitely stay there again and recommend it. Best Mojitos!! If you go into Old San Juan - have a Pina Colada at Barrachina's and found a little hole in the wall - called Punto de Vista - the food was great and fresh! Took a little time to cook, but worth it. The owner Michael is from Jersey! Remember, you can't always rely on reviews....this turned out to be fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “From check-in through check out it was total delight to stay at this SUPERB Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: neroliflor
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive you are welcomed by the educated valet guys... guest check-in is fast, serviceable, and received by a cordial smile. Lindsey Yeager was eager to help me and inform me of the great amenities, like the infinity pool, 24 hour gym facility, and must see SPA. Thank you! Will always remember how friendly and professional Juan Carillo at the pool is! He should be the hotel's pr agent because he made me and my guests feel at home!!!! And he highly spoke of how amazing this hotel is and its management. Great views, amazing pool area, clean rooms, dining is delicious (order the hamburger!-delicious), green options, starbucks coffee in the room, quiet for the ultimate sleep, comfy beds and pillows, room space is perfect, and it is centrally located... Couldn't ask for more! oh, and free wifi.... Employees here know their product and know how to represent SHERATON to a higher level! Bravo! Will make it my place of choice when I visit town!

Reviews.Title: “If only all hotels were like this!”
Reviews.Author: bertiebuttons
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after a cruise. This hotel has great facilities. The room was spacious and very comfortable. There is an excellent swimming pool and outdoor bar with lots of sun chairs and tents for those who don't wish to sit in full sun. We ate in the restaurant and had a most enjoyable dinner served by an extremely attentive waiter who explained local dishes to us. Breakfast was also very good. The reception staff were first class. There is free access to the net - most useful when reconfirming our flights home! Only downside is that the hotel is a taxi ride away from the delightful Old San Juan and taxi fares are not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Rude !!”
Reviews.Author: DBIGMAN
Reviews.Content: Needed to spend a couple of days by the San Juan convention center. I am a Platinum SPG Member and did recieve an upgrade to a junior one bedroom suite. The hotel is fairly new and "clean" but unfortunately not up to the standards that it could be... Issues: Our flight was extremely delayed and we didnt get to the hotel until 1am... Upon Check-In, there was only one person (which is fine at the time of night). He was respectful and nice but very stupid! He first couldnt find my reservation, after he found it he gave us a room with with 2 beds... I didnt find this out until i got into the room. To top off the agitation, It was a wheelchair accessible room type. We were really tired and was about to pass out but I went down and told him... He politely apologized, found my "real" reservation, then finally acknowledged my SPG status... then gave me an envelope which already had my name printed on it (he had failed to give it to me earlier) for breakfast/club privilages. The upgraded room was nice and spacious. Clean, crisp, new feeling. I wish the service felt the same. In-room internet was way over priced for San Juan !! Casino is... eh... nothing special... Half the time the tables are closed and practically empty. Checking Out was a disaster!!! I literally waited 35 minutes on the horrendous line to check out!!!! About 5 people (25 mins) prior to my turn, I flipped out. I started yelling. There were only a couple of front desk personel with managers just standing around (behind them). With my yelling... they FINALLY started opening up the 3 other moniters!! I got applauses from people standing on the line!!!!!! When I got to the desk, I didnt get an apology nor a curteous response.. actually it was some bad attitude!! I asked to speak with a manager and he responded "Your looking at him"... Pretty pathetic... The sad thing is that the pool deck has a great infinity pool overviewing the conference center and a private airport. The spacious deck has ample seating and tanning areas. The outdoor bar was great as well.... The fitness center matched with the SPG standard with clean machines and amenities. Location is not the best... but great if you need access to the conference center. But because of the HORRIBLE service from the FRONT DESK i cannot in my good concious ever recommend this hotel to anyone. I am now looking at reviews and see the same comments... What a surprise... Not!!!! hehe .... Check out the Conrad or the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “they just dont care”
Reviews.Author: nulrik
Reviews.Content: arrived late but welcome at reception was fine - got a room with a constant noice probably from aircon - so had to change room after one night (took most of the day) - during that move i forgot a couple of shirts in one of the draws but did not find out until the day we left the hotel to go on a cruise - phoned the hotel - talked to some security guy who was not very happy to help and would not call me back - called again 2 days later same result, and I have now after my return home send the hotel 2 mails which they have not even replied to at all - just ignored me. I am going to San Juan again but I will NOT stay at this hotel and will not recommend any of you to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at any cost. Unethical, poor service, incompetent accounting department.”
Reviews.Author: FemmeProf
Reviews.Content: The list of grievances is too long to fully enumerate in a review, but I feel it is important to share the key points so that others do not make the dreadful mistake of frequenting this hotel: The Sheraton PR a) double and triple charged multiple credit cards belonging to a colleague with whom I traveled, causing them to be locked; b) withdrew over $1K in extra charges from my checking account without my knowledge or authorization (these charges had nothing to do with the cost of my room, and have yet to be explained by Sheraton management); c) did not return the money until I opened a fraud claim with Bank of America; and d) failed to produce a properly itemized receipt, which means I must fill out a missing receipt affidavit and may or may not be compensated for my lodging by the grant that supported my travels. Moreover, I spent hours over a period of two weeks on the phone with various personnel, including hours that should have been spent at the conference where I was presenting a paper. On top of all this, the hotel itself was not even up to par: dirty coffee grinds in the coffee maker in our room upon arrival; nobody answering phones, including room service (in fact, my colleagues and I had to walk downstairs to the front desk to place an order for room service, because there was no one to take our call); no ink in the business center printers; et cetera. But these little nuisances paled in comparison to the disaster with billing and accounting. I have actually had to cancel my ATM card and open a new card with a different number for my own security, to prevent further unauthorized activity by the Sheraton PR. I have strongly urged the University of Puerto Rico (which cosponsored the conference) not to use the Sheraton for any future professional meetings, and I will certainly spread the word among my colleagues at other universities throughout the United States. This experience has been a nightmare and I would not wish it on anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: jms81
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! Loved the infinity pool on the 4th floor. They also have a nice spa if u wanna get a massage, facial, etc. Beds are extremely comfortable. Rooms were very clean. Staff was helpful and friendly. This hotel was only a few miles away from Old San Juan. I'd recommend going across the street from the hotel to the bus stop (costs 75 cents i believe) and get dropped off at Old San Juan bus terminal so u can walk around the town...otherwise parking is a pain...wear comfortable shoes! I traveled with two friends and we definitely enjoyed our stay. We'll stay at this hotel anytime we visit PR :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and new, but far from the action”
Reviews.Author: citygal07
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Convention Hotel is directly adjacent to the impressive convention center. The development was planned to be much larger, with office, residential and other retail as part of the area. Unfortunately, the recession has hit PR too, and work has stopped at the other construction sites in this area. I guess that is a good thing because it means no construction noise! The hotel is well designed with a nice lobby, bar and restaurant on the main level- along with a casino. The 4th level has a roof deck with pool, cabanas, hot tub, etc. - all very nice. The biggest complaint I have is about the location. I like to go for a run in the morning and it was difficult to get anywhere nice to run. I had to either cross the freeway or go through some not-so-nice parts of town. The front desk didn't have a walking map or any suggestions on where to run. I went on 2 runs from here- but next time, will try to find something closer to either Old San Juan area or beaches. Maybe in the future when the rest of this area gets built up, this area will be more walkable/runnable.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new and comfortable! But the taxi rides kill ya.”
Reviews.Author: jas577
Reviews.Content: I believe this is the newest in Starwood's chain and it's really nice. Rooms are super comfy, stylish and immaculate. Also, if you have access to the Club Floor, there's a great lounge overlooking the marina and old town - amazing view! The problem? You're a hostage to the hotel. You can't walk anywhere fun, so unless you have a car (and you'll have to pay $16 / day for that for parking), you have to take taxis. And the taxis, though readily available, are really expensive. $12 to Condado or Old Town (I think - maybe even $15). It adds up, especially with round trips. The alternatives? Eat at the good, but very expensive, hotel restaurant. Or spend the night gambling in the small, but stylish, casino. No thanks - next time I'll just stay closer to town. It's a shame though - as far as chain hotels go, this was a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “shame on sheraton”
Reviews.Author: JuntaPunk
Reviews.Content: After thirteen hours of transit to get the hotel I was met by a very unwelcoming lady at the front desk. This was just the beginning. The hotel does not offer currency exchange services, which was unusual, due to the fact that the hotel serves primarily a business client. Then the kitchen, ooh the kitchen. If it was not bugs in my food (yes..bugs), it was $54 USD for frozen fish sticks with shoe string fries...give me a break! Housekeeping deserves an honorable mention...simply the worst. Do yourself a favor and stay away. A hotel not worthy of the Sheraton flag. I can't wait to get back to my office and have this hotel added to the NO STAY list.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: majcigar
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through HOTWIRE and picked it up for 139.00 per night. The location is absolutely horrible for those wishing to go on any touring or eat at any restaurants in Condado area. The taxi cost were absolutely ridiculous. They changed each time we took a ride. Took a cab from hotel to cruise dock 1 mile for 12.00. There are no restaurants in the area other than the hotels, which are extremely expensive. The drinks in the bar averaged about $12.00. (not worth the price!) As for the hotel itself, the room was small, the walls were paper thin (noisy), the music playing in the pool area reverberated off the windows (on 8th floor) unitl midnight. The front desk would do nothing about this. The bathroom in the lbby had a horrible smell. The bathroom in the room had mold in the grout. This is the worst Sheraton I have ever stayed at. They should be embarrassed.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient location for leisure travel”
Reviews.Author: kxv2
Reviews.Content: We got the hotel via Hotwire so had a great rate, however this was not a great location for anyone traveling on vacation or just staying a night for a cruise. Unless you prefer to eat at the hotel restaurants, there literally was nothing in walking distance - you're surrounded by other hotels and the convention center. Taxis to Old San Juan and Condado, where all the restaurants are, were about $15 one-way. The hotel is newer so was clean as expected. The staff were very friendly, though the check-in process probably took two or three times longer than normal. It's right across the street from the Convention Center so I'm guessing this is going to be a great spot for business or convention go-ers but avoid the location if you can if you want to walk to restaurants or attractions. It was even a $12 ride to the PanAm cruise pier which was in walking distance (but no side walks to conveniently haul luggage).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but the taxi rides add up if you are touring”
Reviews.Author: detraveler_7
Reviews.Content: We really liked the hotel. It is new and so very clean. The pool is good but a bit loud for my taste. The fitness center is very good. We booked the club level so breakfast should have been included but the club is not finished yet. They gave us coupons for breakfast which was fine. The bartenders in the lounge were very friendly and made some interesting drinks. Our only issue was that it cost $15 each way back and forth to Old San Juan so if you go to tour during the day and return for dinner at night it adds up a bit. On the weekends the traffic into the historic district is crazy so going in for dinner takes a lot of time. That said, we would stay here again since the rooms are much better than what we saw in the historic area.

Reviews.Title: “Egh. Kinda feel like we wasted our money.”
Reviews.Author: Superwoman07
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Sheraton on Valentine's Day almost three hours after check in time and were originally told that our room wasn't ready and it would be another hour... but then, while we were doing a pre-check-in, the room showed as available, so what could have been a big deal, turned out not to be. The facility of the hotel is beautiful. Very well done and open. Very clean. The front desk staff was nice, not over friendly, but nice enough. The staff outside was super friendly and helpful, and got cabs for us immediately when we needed them. We were given two good restaurant suggestions before we went into Old San Juan. Our room was large and the design is great. Beautiful bed and chair in the room. The Bliss bath products were a plus for me who adores Bliss. Samuel, the bartender in the main lobby lounge was fantastic! He made great drinks, was super friendly, and we had a lovely conversation with him about different local foods and things to do. Valentine's night, there was also a very talented singer performing, and we really enjoyed listening to her. Those are the good things; here are the bad: The dream bed... it not a dream. It felt like a basic, hotel grade mattress. Nothing special at all. But the BIGGEST problem with the room is that there are only sheers over the majority of the window space- which means that you are woken up with the sun blazing into your room the second the sun is up. That is NOT good.... and reason enough that I would never stay here again. The location of the hotel isn't great. It's between the beach areas and Old San Juan... which means you can't walk to anything and whether you go to the beach or to OSJ, you're going to pay $30 round trip cab fare. We spent the day roaming around El Morro and Old San Juan and were tired enough that we decided to just head back to the hotel to have dinner... big mistake. The Choices restaurant on site was having a Valentine's deal, and I think you could order off the regular menu as well... but either way, we weren't interested. The menu was small and uninteresting. And had nothing on there that was any type of Puerto Rican food- disappointing. The food in the lounge was more a tapas type menu, and not really what we were looking for either. We were looking for a nice gourmet style Puerto Rican meal or seafood of some type, but after asking the front desk for suggestions close by and getting none, we gave up and ended up ordering delivery pizza b/c by that point we were just tired and hungry... we saw the delivery guy in the lobby about 6 or 7 times while we were waiting on ours to arrive, so obviously, more than just us had the same issue. For breakfast the next morning, we were hoping to be able to order food and eat outside by the pool (which was beautiful), but the pool side cafe wasn't opened (it closed early the night before as well... and the pool closed at 8- super early in my opinion) We ended up eating the Choices breakfast buffet for $19 each... it was your typical overpriced hotel buffet. Not bad at all, but not worth $40 for the two of us either. Check out was painless. They do put a $100 hold on your card for things like, breakfast and the bar, etc, and thatâ€™s fine, but the employee who checked me in would not have told me this except that I asked him why he needed to run my card when I had pre-paid for the stay. I donâ€™t have a problem with them putting a hold on my accountâ€¦ but I do have a problem with them not telling me this up front. So overall, it was just kind of a blah experience. We could have stayed somewhere else for much cheaperâ€¦ and not had to spend $100 in cab faresâ€¦ and it would have been really, really nice to be able to sleep in on a getaway weekend and not be woken up with the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ml_812
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in December before a cruise. Great location if your going on a cruise...right near the Pan American cruise terminal. The hotel is brand new and beautifully decorated. Loved the pool area, especially the private cabanas. Restaurants are a bit pricey, but the food was great. Although we didn't eat there, the restaurant next to the convention center (Ficus) had a more affordable menu and seemed like it would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveltime47
Reviews.Content: Hi can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel. The staff, across the board, from the guys at the front door to the room service attendants to the dancers (!!) in the casino to the amazing personality pool waiters/waitresses to the front desk people! EVERYONE was happy to be there and happy to help us. We were there for ten days over Christmas and had a wonderful time. Personally, I loved the location. We were close to Old San Juan, Condado and highways so we could get up and go. We felt like we had won a prize--a brand new hotel with people who were happy to help us and it wasn't swamped with tourists. The hotel is beautiful. The pool area is relaxing and laid out wonderfully. We previously stayed in a hotel with a very similar layout in Curacoa (Marriott) last year. They both have pools above the ground level which makes for interesting views. This pool area far outshines the one in Curacao--larger with more room for privacy. The only negative regarding the pool area is that whatever kind of lounge chairs they bought they are quickly mildewing. The gym is AMAZING! Everything is new, there was ALWAYS availability and there were diagrams on the walls describing different exercises. The only downfalls were that the spa was not open and there was only one restaurant open. Also, the pay-per-view movies program was not yet up and running so we devised our own setup using our laptop. This is to be expected for a new hotel. I'm sure these things will be functional soon. This is a beautiful, brand new hotel with wonderful, helpful employees. Thank you to everyone for providing us with a much needed relaxing vacation! (especially Dominique)

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: MariaR9
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton had exceptional customer service, was very clean and comfortable and was the Convention center is right outside the door. Taxis to Old San Juan are reasonable and during the day, buses are also right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: SFOPhil
Reviews.Content: New hotel but poor service. As a Platinum SPG member, very poor recognition and no upgrade. I really wish I stayed at another hotel! Do yourself a favor and stay anywhere else!
